text: Pours black and dense, with a small brown head, which faded quickly, slimy lacing. Aroma of roasted malts, dark fruit and vanilla. Tastes boozy, medium sweet, low bitterness, notes of vanilla, roasted malts, ripe dark fruits and molasses. Full body, slick feel, soft carbonation, bitter finish. Overall a very stout-ish porter, thick, tasty: a silent (not too silent) killer.

Bottle from Utobeer Market Stall, Borough. Black pour with a tan head. Coffee, licorice, cola, dark chocolate, caramel aroma. Flavours of dark roast coffee, raisin, cocoa, cola, dark chocolate. Coffee roast linger on the palate. Dry, sweet smoky finish.Lovely stuff, right up my street.

Bottle a black colored beer with a beige head aroma malts roasted malts laurel citrus fruits alcohol dark fruits and hops flavor malts roasted malts spicy laurel fruits alcohol dark fruits and bitter hops
Piwo skonsumowane. Ocena na podstawie retrospekcji w celu uzupełnienia profilu.

Bottled (backlog). Black colour, small beigeish brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, some raisins, plum, ripe fruits, mild ashes as well as some slight coffee and nutty notes. Flavour is syrupy, some roasted malts, nuts, mild toffee, coffee and some alcohol as well as some dried dark fruits to it. Overall rather sweet, but still quite a pleasant one.
Klares, sehr dunkles Braun mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Röstmalzig, süßlich, dunkle Schokolade, leicht fruchtig, Waldbeeren, etwas alkoholisch, leicht bitter.

Pours a very dark brown or black color. Maybe half finger brown head. Poor retention, very light lacing. Not much to see here.Aroma is coffee, chocolate, caramel, brown sugar. Lots of dark fruits, especially prunes. Dark roasted malts. Lots of malt. Whiff of alcohol.Taste is burnt brown sugar. Dark fruits, especially prunes. Chocolate, caramel. Not too much coffee. It actually reminds me of a barleywine. Quite sweet.Mouthfeel is full bodied, no doubt about it. Sweet, sticky, thick, heavy. Also a little alcohol bitterness.Overall, I initially rated this quite low, but it has grown on me. It took a while, but I like it quite a bit. No, I wouldnt recommend this to most people, but I would buy it again.

Czarne, nieprzejrzyste. Piana kremowa, drobna, średnio-obfita, lacingu brak. W zapachu praliny, trochę pumpernikiel, mleczna czekolada, kakao, ogólnie bardzo słodko. Zresztą podobnie w smaku. Również dominuje słodycz - mleczna czekolada, trochę kakao, to wszystko lekko kontrują kwaśne, ciemne owoce, ale na krótko. Po chwili znowu wraca słodyczka. Goryczka niska, posmak kakaowo-czekoladowy, nasycenie średnie.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2017 Aspetto esemplare, nera con ampia Schiuma marrone a grana molto fine e compatta. Al naso tostatura drake fruits e una nota alcolica. Al palato piuttosto dolce, con malto caramello tostatura. Corpo medio, molto cremosa, alcol ben evidente. Peccato solo una dolcezza un pelo eccessiva.
Bottle. Pours black with small tan head. Aroma and taste have licorice, roasted malt, coffee, dark bread and dark fruits. Sweet, smooth and very enjoyable!

butelka/czarne, nieprzejrzyste, niemal zaraz od nalania brak piany. w aromacie mleczna czekolada, lukrecja, szlachetny alkohol, po ogrzaniu całość ładnie dopełniają słody palone. w smaku na starcie słodkie, przechodzące w goryczkowe od słodów palonych, krótki goryczkowy finisz. nasycenie niskie
355ml bottle. Pours black with tanned lacing. Licorice, dark fruits, plums, roasted malts. Sweet. Complex and very good. Creamy mouthfeel. One of the best.

Bottle. Black in color with a small tan head. Roasted malts, vinous and plummy sweetness in aroma. Quit smooth mouthfeel. Sweet syrupy and bit of roasted bready malts in taste. Bit on the sweeter side. Coffee sweet vinous finish. Expected this to be a good nightcap, but the sweetness ruined it a bit.

Might be best Porter I've had yet. Dark rich almost like adult root beer. Sweet without being treakely. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft from Giant Eagle in Grandview: got a 5oz taster, but liked it enough to go back for a pint. black pour, tan head. aroma of roasted malts, faint soy. tastes are woody, chocolate, light bitter, dark fruit, coffee, molasses, caramel. lots going on and very drinkable. oily palate.
Dark brown to black. Not transparent. Beige head. Big dark fruit, nuts, Port on nose. Full body. Nutty taste. Rich. Vinous. Very nice-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle at home. Pours pitch black with no head whatsoever. Smells like liquorice, fruits, cognac. Tastes follows with more dark fruits, liquorice, cognac barrel, roasted malts, faint black coffee, a bit of ash. The alcohol is present, although not bothersome. There is sweetness to it and bitterness, but both very low. There is almost no carbonation. I love it.

Medium, quite fresh and sweet aroma with dark fruits and some bourbon. Pitch black color with no head. Strong, balanced taste with sweet and slightly sour, dry nuances of dark fruits like plum. Bourbon, licorice and some sweetish, roasted malts and vanilla. Wide taste spectrum and long aftertaste with slightly roasted malts and licorice. Medium/strong body with medium carbonation. Overall, considering imperial porter, this quite nails it: almost like imperial stout but with slight bitter, more edge feeling. Alcohol comes trough a bit too much.

Aroma: roasted malt, caramel, cognac, dried fruits.
Appearance: black with quickly disappeared brown foam.
Taste: dried fruits, roasted malts, caramel, sweetness and a bit dry in finish.
Palate: smooth, full-bodied, light carbonation.

355ml bottle dated 14 September 2015, bought at Bliznetsy in Moscow. Pours pitch black with a small dark brown head. Aroma is cognac, dark sweet cherries, and roastiness. Taste is very liqueurish, like cognac, espresso and brown sugar. A very intense and complex beer, for sure.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, dark fruit, chocolate, mocha and roasted malts.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with a medium dark brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, dark fruit, chocolate and mocha; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Great roasted beer with some sort of brown sugar added to make it a Porter. Amazing appearance and flavour, together with a great aroma and palate. Has no really bad aspects.

(12oz bottle) Pours an opaque black body with a spare brown head. Aroma of chocolate, toffee, roasted malt, vanilla, caramel, marshmallow, and light coffee. Flavor of roasted malt, chocolate, caramel, ash, and some licorice.

Pours thick and black with a nice, creamy, dark tan head. Aroma is malty, some roastedness, raisins, a bit of coffee. Taste is slightly sweet in the beginning, more of bitterness towards end with roasted malts and coffee. Oily mouthfeel with above medium carbonation. Its really good, thank you based god.

(Bottle, 0.355 l - batch #013, from Alko Arkadia, 20170113) The beer poured black. Its head was medium sized and lightly brown. Aroma had burnt malts, dark chocolate, cocoa and sweetness. Palate was full bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were burnt malts, coffee, dark chocolate, ash, sweetness and bitterness. Aftertaste had burnt malts, chocolate and bitterness. A well done burnt brew that hid its high ABV and wasnt too sweet.

Poured into a snifter, this had a black color with a thin fingers worth of white to off white foamy head that quickly dies off. Moderate stringy lace.
The aroma takes on a nice balance between the roast, the sweet and the bitter. Coffee beans, chocolate malts and some marshmallow riding in nicely.
The flavor leans towards the roast first while bringing the sweetness in for a great balance. Sly roasty to bitter to semi-sweet aftertaste running into the finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a fair sessionable to sipping quality about it. Mild carbonation. Some light slickness.
Overall, damn nice beer for a cold Winters night. Definitely would have again.

Pullo @ Alko. Kaatuu snifteriin sysimustana ja noin sormen paksuisella katoavalla vaahdolla. Hyvin monipuolinen tuoksu tarjoilee tummia hedelmiä (pääasiassa luumua), vanilijaa, soijamaisuutta, lakritsia ja maamaisuutta, kaikkia tasaisesti hedelmäisyyden erottuessa hieman joukosta. Vaahtokarkkikin tulee hieman mieleen. Maku jatkaa monipuolista linjaa: lakritsia, puumaisuutta, vaahtokarkkia, luumua, soijaa ja maamaisuutta. Puu tulee nyt hyvin vahvana mukaan ja laittaa vanilijan kanssa miettimään, onkohan tätä pidetty tynnyrissäkin tai ainakin heitetty lastuja mukaan. Suutuntuma on hyvin paksu, makeahko sekä täyteläinen ja tuntuu melko humaloidulta. Upean monipuolinen imperial porter, jossa päällimmäisenä jää mieleen luumuisuus ja muu tumma hedelmä, vanilija sekä lakritsi. Mutta löytyy paljon muutakin, loistava tekele.

Bottle from Js. Pours a deep brown to light black with a half finger of head that dissipates quickly. Big marshmallow nose with milk chocolate, ovaltine and some treacle notes with a touch of peach. Fruity and vinous on the palate with more chocolate and marshmallow notes. Medium bodied with a smooth rich treacle flavor. Alcohol is hidden so well. Smooth finish that lingers.

Bottle 33cl.
@ Zombier, Malaga, Spain.
A: Black.
T: Roasted malt, caramel, chocolate.
cocoa sweet noise. Ink black pour. no head. sweet molasses and cocoa, with boozy finish. Leads sweet and stays there. Great thick palate that coats the tongue.

355ml bottled 2014-02-19, almost 3 years. Pour pitch black with a reddish notes, no foam. Aroma of toffee, molasse and warm spirits. Same for the taste. Medium carbonation and medium body for the style and age of this bottle. oily and a bit creamy. Nice long and warm finish of sweet molasse and alcohol.

Color negro con ligera transparencia, espuma baja-nula poca retención. Malta maltoso tostado moderado, ésteres a aceituna botija alto, regalís, chocolate bitter, ciruela negra, licoroso, fenol a vainilla, lúpulo terroso bajo. En boca malta maltoso tostado moderado alto, tibieza alcohólica, ésteres a aceituna botija alto, regalís, chocolate bitter, ciruela negra,fenol a vainilla, canela, azúcar morena, lúpulo terroso moderado-moderado bajo, lúpulo de amargor bajo-nulo. Final maltoso-alcohólico prolongado, con cuerpo y baja carbonatación.

Bottle as a birthday gift from Jill. Cheers! Pours quite inky black with a good frothy beige head. Aroma of treacle and black fruits. The taste is quite sweet with black fruits again and moderate spice. Fruit cake, coffee, liquorice, ash and treacle follow with a lingering bitter finish. Very nice.

Aroma: dark bread, prunes. Touch of chocolate and grain coffee. There is also a hint o vanilla. Average intensity. Taste. Dried fruits, some coffee, pumpernickel. toffee. Medium body, carbonation low. Alcoholic aftertaste. Sweet. Slightly pungent.

12 oz bottle with a batch stamp of #013. 

Pours very dark brown but looks nearly black and opaque in the glass. Small weak head and little lacing. 

Aroma: light booze, molasses, dark dried fruits and a hint of cookie dough.

Flavor: Sweet notes mix with dark dried fruits, toffee, molasses and faint booze. 

Feel: Thick: low carbonation. Very smooth

Overall: a potent and BIG porter with fairly well hidden alcohol.

Tap @Hevelka 2016 Zaklęte Rewiry stand
Backlog. Intense, rich and thick - a monster of a porter! Plums and vanilla are beautifully exposed! Alcohol hidden very well.

Black beer. Low carbonation bit thick, smooth palate. Standard porter flavors woth rkasted malt but some other things as well. I taste sigar, lactose maybe, and it is lightly tart with berries. Unusual. Good beer.

Bottle - Black color with a brown head that quickly disappears. Taste is chocolate, toffee, caramel, dark malts, a bit roasted. Faint fruity hoppy aromas. Quite sweet. Finish is a bit too boozy, dry. Nice.

Dark brown/black color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of toasted sweet malt, vanilla, caramel, & licorice; Flavor of roasted sweet malt, caramel, molasses/syrup, dark chocolate, dark fruit, and some coffee; Warm boozy finish; Nicely balanced; Pretty intense - nice sipper.
12oz bottle in trade with dmac, thanks. Dissipating brown-black. A-sweet dk malt-molasses/cocoa. T-follows with some hop bite.

Bottle - pours like runny black tar withbshort lived brown head. Aroma is sweet chocolate and dark fruits. Taste follows the aroma, sweet but not sickly, all bitterness balanced out, to leave a smooth perfect drink that masks its strong alcohol far too effectively! Paired with a Kriek de Jacobins, its the perfect combination!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The beer has got a deep black colour with a smooth body and smooth head. Aroma of chocolate and coffee. Taste of bittersweet chocolate, malt, turf, coffee, espresso, barrel, woods and rum. Intense and tasty finish.

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2017 W aromacie nuty ciemnego chleba, ciemne owoce, śliwki, wanilia, nieco estrów, bardzo przyjemnie. W wyglądzie czarne z lekką brązową pianką. W smaku dość słodkie, mocno owocowe - nuty ciemnych owoców, śliwek, nuty porteru bałtyckiego i belgijskiego abta, do tego nuty kawowe, czekoladowe, nieco goryczkowa kontra, przyjemnie rozgrzewające, bardzo fajnie ułożone. Słodycz, dzięki lekko chmielowej, nieco grejpfrutowej kontrze niezamulająca. Ciało bardzo konkretne, gęste, Ogólnie bardzo smaczny, stosunkowo słodki imperialny porter przywodzący na myśl portera bałtyckiego. Bardzo dobre piwo.
Kolsvart med litet brunt skum. Doftar och smakar kaffe och choklad. väldigt söt med bra fyllighet
Bottle at home. Pours oily black with copper head. Aroma is dried fruits, cocoa, coffee and booze. Taste is roasty malts, coffee, booze and subtle hops. Long finish. Well balanced palate. Very nice.

bottle conditioned. sipped with a sniffer pairing with French cheese cake. big tan head. intense aroma of hops，sugar，malts, and mix of barrels. bitter，brown sugar, caramel，sweetness，syrup,honey， creamy, thick, very rich body. complex spice，warm finish.

Bottle. Dark, almost black, thick, with a dark brown foam. Powerful aroma: malts, red port wine, a barrel, old whisky, sweet caramel, roasted, chocolate. Taste: sweet caramel malt, chocolate, prunes, port, cognac, very warming. Great beer!

the aroma is caramel and fruity with hints of vanilla, port, dark chocolate, toffee and raisin... the taste is caramel and fruity with notes of roasted malt, red wine, brown chocolate, dried plum and toffee... sweet and dry aftertaste...

DWF; Bottle 12 FL OZ, drunk at Melkebaren. Pours moderate, black with a creamy, lacing and lasting tan head. Nose is heavy, tosted malt, rich milk chocolate, coffe, moderate prunes, vanilla and light alchol, wood and spice. Taste is heavy sweet and light bitter with lasting chocolate, warming finish. Body is full, texture is thick, carbonation is soft.
Good beer. !aaaaaaaaaaasaaawaawwsjfjfjfjfjfjfjfjfjfjfjfj

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2016 A fizzy tan head that dissipates quickly on an inky black body. Nose features candied fruit, chocolate and a touch of bubble gum. The taste is truly porter like - a range of dark tastes but not as dense and heavy as a stout. A chocolate lead is accompanied by dark berries, biscuit malt, caramel, molasses, slightly burnt butter and some fruity hops. There are hints of booze and cream and that unusual bubble gum element in a well rounded profile. A hint of acidity keeps the finish cleaner than stouts.  If the nose on this imperial were not so mild, it would be rating with the very, very best.

Lots of vinous fruits and dark sugar on the nose. Surprisingly lighter body than anticipated with soft carbonation. Taste is of chocolate, molasses and a good hop bitterness to follow. Very nice 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330 ml bottle. Thanks Michael! Black color with beige head. Roasted malty aroma, chocolate, caramel, dark dried fruits, vinous, alcohol. Sweet and light bitter taste like aroma. Medium to full oily silky body with soft carbonation.

Bottle from Bottle Baron. Black body with a thin beige head that fades. No lacing. Aroma of plum, treacle and liquorice. Flavour of blueberries, tar and soy sauce. Medium body with a slick texture. Soft fizz. Sharp and tangy.
Drank 09-09-16. Nice beer! Very good combination of porter-like thickness, with a good amount of sweetness. Really good.

Overpowering booze, syrup, brown sugar, bitter chocolate and vanilla. Not enough malt to back this up. Just gets stronger as it warms. The beer is seriously hopped and wont let you down there. Its a chocolate chip cookie with rum and hops.
Zwarte kleur met een goede bruine kraag. Ruikt vol, vanille, zacht, fruitig chocolade. Smaakt vol, chocolade, koffie, mout, mocha vanille. Lekker.

Black. Big aroma and flavour, with caramel malt, chocolate, roasted barley and alcohol. Very sweet, pungent and spicy, with a dry, bitter and alcoholic finish. Full body. Overall, a good imperial porter, although I am somewhat ambivalent about it. Sure, this is full-bodied and tasty, but it is also too sweet and pungent. The balance is way off. Great at first, but it soon becomes cloying and I did not really feel like finishing the bottle.

Flaske 355ml. Gave fra Rune. Drukket på Lillehøgda 11 Aug 16. Svart. Høyt luftig mokkafarget skum som daler veldig sakte. Pene filigranser. Lett sjokoladearoma med spor av rosiner. Smaken lett søtlig lakris & mandler. Alkoholen godt kamuflert. God!
How: bottle Appearance: almost black with a small tanned head. Aroma: prunes, chocolate, coffee,dark caramel, madeira, vanilla and toast. Palate: full body, soft carbonation.

Pours deep black with no head. Nose is cough syrup and bourbon. First mouthfeel is very sweet. Aromas are dark chocolate, raisin, mint notes. Low carbonation, medium body. Long sweet finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottled 33cl. Color : very dark ale with very thin white head. Nose : mint, aniseed flavoured, soja sauce. Aromas : raisins, honey, spices, soja. Heavy texture, low carbonation, low bitterness.

12oz bottle via 4pack from Spirits Jackson. Poured a viscous deep black body under a dense yet quick fading tight foamy mocha head. Aroma of dark chocolate, soy sauce, booze, dark fruits, burnt vanilla extract. Flavor is similar with a lot of dark fruit and dark berries coming through before a big burnt malts roasty finish. Medium body with solid heat on the backend. Really nice.

Pour dark chocolately brown. Little to no head, very little carobonation, oily body. Malty aromas of cookies, chocolate, mocha, whiskey, vanilla, and alcohol. Easy to drink, very sweet, but not cloyingly so. Has a decent amount of bitterness. Very little hop flavor or aroma. Tastes of rich chocolate dessert. Very good. One of the better of the style.

A smell of malt, coffee, chocolate. The body is black, the head is small, beige and it disappears fast. A strong malty taste of coffee and chocolate. The body is strong, very creamy with a soft carbonation.

Bottle acquired at South Lyndale Liquors. Poured into a Belgian snifter glass. Deep cola brown...almost black. Minor tannish head. Nose is big and boozy with chocolate, burnt sugars, caramel, vanilla, and plenty of roast. Taste follows suit continuing to emphasize a high alcohol content with a healthy burn/bite towards the end. Plenty of chocolate layers with a higher sugar content than other chocolate-forward efforts Ive sampled. Caramel and molasses also play a part and there is a vanilla presence in the finish. This is the epitome of a dessert beer and definitely tasty. You dont want to mess around with this one...the ABV will come back to haunt you.

Bottle 0,33 with Kristian and Slacker. Pours black with minimal beige head. Aroma of chocolate, roasted malts, raisins, hint of coffee, alcohol is noticeable. Taste of coffee, cocoa, dark fruits. A bit sourness with balances the sweetness. Full body, oily texture, flat almost none carbonation.

Bármikor szívesen fogadom az efféle aromákat, amelyekkel a sűrű és átlátszatlan, ördögien fekete főzet rendelkezik, a marcipános, fondüs színezetű, alacsonyan szálló illatnyalábok érett és sötét mondanivalótól terhes tömege örömmel látott vendég az "imperial" jelzőre különösen fogékony rajongók háza táján. Teltkarcsú alkoholos jegyek röpködnek mindenfelé, izgalmas bevezetője ez minden nagy kaliberű italnak. A kortyok természetesen lágyak és krémesek, sziruposak, túlfűtöttek, kirobbanóan teltek. Fekete cseresznyés, befőttes, meggymagos-marcipános karakter hordozói, mézédes maláta olvadékony, csokoládéfagylaltos hangulatának közvetítői. Az Evil Twin a súlyos fekete főzetek terén kimagasló minőséget képvisel, ebben az italban sem kell csalódnia senkinek.

Czarne z obfita trwała pianą ładnie koronkującą 
Lukrecji beza alkohol słodka pianka gnój :))- niesamowity
Średnie ku niskiemu niskie nasycenie bardzo gładkie kawowy finisz 
Cappuccino czekolada słodka pianka alkohol beza
Py-cho-ta ta bezowa słodycz przejmująca kontrolę nad czekoladą i kawą jest niesamowita.

30-JUL-2016, bottle @home, from Boxers, brought by Erik, thx. :-)
Black with a low lasting tan head.
Roast, berry, coffee. Smooth, full, soft carbonation. Touch of tartness, a little sweet, and very porter-like. So nice:-)
On tap @ Beertemple. The aroma has green apples, some roast, chocolate, booze. Black coloured beer with a medium head. The taste is light bitter and sweet, is boozy and has green apples. Mèh.

Bottled 355ml. -at Pivoteka Zagreb. Pitch black coloured, medium sized brown head, light roasty and whiff of green apple in the nose (wtf, green apple...all three of us noticed it). Sweet roasted malt, chocolate, noticable alcohol and tar like finish. Touch of licorice as well. Too boozy stuff.
Almost black with small brown head. Sweet and winey aroma. Bitter with vanilla sweetness and touch of dried fruits. Roasted grain notes. Slight vanilla aftertaste.

Bottle @ Bryggeriet, Ystad 20160729. Roasted, malty, fruity and really sweet, dried fruits, chocolate, soya sauce, notes of licorice, medium to full body with an oily texture. The finish is bitter, roasted and sweet, dried fruits, notes of chocolate and alcohol.
This lil B is a big ol porter. Bitter chocolate, dark fruit, molasses and essence of the depths of hell. Tasty.

Style et résumé: Superbe porter imperial. 
Comment: En fût au Saint-Bock finale Euro 2016.
Portrait: Une robe brune foncée presque noire avec une mousse collante beige. Un nez de mélasse, doutils en bonbon, iodé, fumé et presque oxydé comme un xeres Pedro Ximenez. Une bouche ronde et enveloppante, une douce carasse pour le palais. Des saveurs intenses de caramel, mélasse, dattes et raisins secs. Superbe. 
Note:  8+/10

[Jan 9 2016] Bottle from Bethesda Food and Beverage. Black body with slight tan head. Nose is malty, toasty, caramel and some coffee. Taste is really nice of malts, roasty, coffee, chocolate and dark fruits. A great Porter. Nice and bitter in the finish.

Black, small brown head. Roasted aromas with chocolate and some sweet vanilla lingering in the nostrils. Taste is a nice chocolate bar, with some bitter dark roasted malt during the finish. Really good.

Bottle. Pours black with brown fading head. Aroma of roasted malts, burned caramel, chocolate and vanilla. Taste is complex with roasted malt, roasted caramel, dried fruit, chocolate and vanilla. Finish is quite bitter.
Very decent, but too high ratings. Not much aroma, very straight forward taste, malty, some woodyness.

On tap at eleszto importer. Pitch black colour small brown head disappears almost instantly. Nose is dried fruits with some soysuce in the background. Taste is medium high sweetness wih strong dried fruits and molasses. Almost too geil. Full creamy mouthfeel, well hidden alcohol. A little bit more bitterness could balace it out better imo.
Pours pitch black almost no foam. No nose! In mouth good chocolate and coffee, a touch (tiny) of licorice and dried black plums. Great beer, well balanced, easy drinking, very mild sweetness.

Draft at Craft and Draft, Amsterdam. Black with a tan head. Sweet aroma of dark chocolate, roasted malts, coffee. Taste is moderate to heavy sweet,moderate bitter, dark chocolate, roasted malts, alcohol. Sweet bitter chocolate aftertaste. Nice.

Intensive aroma with melanoidines, smoked plum, coffee, cocoa cake, great baltic porter notes. Mouthfeel is thick, full and sweet but this sweetness increases the experience of beer being full bodied. An extremely enjoyable beer with no hints of alcohol, complex and very well drinkable. One of best porters I have ever drunk

Taps rich coffee sable with a fair tan head. Aroma delivers roast malt, coffee, and barleywine-like fruity tones. Flavor presents roast malt, coffee, woody, fruity, and subtle semi-sweet chocolate notes. Body is firm, fizz is OK. Get a lil B in your tummy.Earlier Rating: 1/14/2016 Total Score: 4Pours deep sable with a thick and persistent tan head. Aroma is not strong, but presents promising toasty malt, fruity and woody notes. Flavor delivers more than what the aroma promises - molasses, roast malt, slightly charred hops, hints of pear and licorice. And a sneaky alcohol bite. Mouthfeel features firm, viscous body and good fizz. No lil beer, a worthy one.
Bottle (12oz) Dark brown with little head. Dark fruit, dark chocolate with some bitter ness in the end. Full bodied, light carbonation. Some coffee too seems to l inger.

Bottle from Brew Bristol.
Appearance: medium brown head, very dark brown colour, almost black.
Aroma: dry plums, coffee, vanila, dark chocolate, roast.
Taste: sweetness of fruits, then bitterness of coffee and chocolate, amazing!
Palate: full bodied, thick, long finish, well balanced, although a bit of alcohol, average carbonation.
Overall: Wow! Very drinkable, fantastic beer, love it!

Bottle. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma of chocolate, light roast, licorice, light vanilla sweet notes, molasses, sweet caramel. Taste is very sweet, toffee, molasses, sweet, licorice. Very sweet, but balanced and very drinkable. Nice
Bottle from whole foods. Black with a brown head. Aroma of dark fruit, wood, roast, and molasses. Medium-full bodied. Sweet, fruity, roasty, and a little spiced tasting. Very good.

Aromat fajnie wylezakowanego porteru bałtyckiego, ciemne owoce czekolada, lekko kwaskowa i palona kawa, cukierki truflowe 
W smaku gładkie i słodkie, czekoladowe, posmak ciemnych owoców, wyraźnej kwaśnej/palony kawy i czekolady, bardzo cukierkowy charakter

Nice brownish black pour. Aromas of chocolate/coffee/tobacco. Didnt seem 11.5 ABV, alcohol is well masked. Big flavor on this beer.

Draft into a tulip. Deep opaque, black brown. Strong aroma of molasses and espresso beans. Quite bitter, some sweetness. Hints of some spice. Quite upfront alcohol. Quite heavy, very oily mouthfeel. Lots of acidity. Very good.

Pours black with a thin beige head. Good lacing. Aromas of dark chocolate, dark fruit, and coffee. Flavors are coffee, dark fruit, vinous tones, black chocolate. molasses and bready notes. Slightly syrupy mouthfeel that coats the tongue. Boozy. Very malty. Nice.

Thy body is black as a starless night, thy head may be lil but... oh, whatever... the small brown head sticks around for some time before it ends up as a partially covering film. Inviting and strong aroma of chocolate, dark caramel and other dark roasted malty notes. In the back I get sweet dark dried fruits, leather and liquorice, and some faint vinous hints of alcohol. Delicious and intense flavour of dark chocolate, bitter chocolate, chocolate sauce, roasted malt and dark dried fruits. Some well integrated notes of cognac-like alcohol dwell in the background, along with vanilla and traces of black currants. The taste is moderate sweet, with a fairly heavy bitter, everlasting finish. Full body, oily to creamy texture, soft carbonation. A marvellous brew! 
[35.5 cl bottle, enjoyed a decade before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Online]

02/19/14 12oz bottle. Pours an opaque black with a thin, film of a head. Aroma has great notes of dark roasted malts, caramel, slight smoke, and faint coffee. Taste is bitter but with a solid sweetness. Roasted malts, hints of pine and resin, caramel, dark sugar, and a coffee bitter ending. Medium-full body with a low-medium carbonation. Slightly syrupy in the mouth with a full carbonation. Overall a really nice, high abv beer. Lots of roasted malts, caramel, smoke, and caramel.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2016 Black coloured beer with small, brown head. Spare lacing. Nice warm aroma of alcohol, roasted malt, coffee, charcoal. Taste is heavy sweet with some bitterness hidden. Smooth, oily and thick in palate. Full body. Flat carbonation. Light alcohol. Sweet, liquor aftertaste. Medium lasting. Delicious beer
Alles drin für ein Imperial Porter. Tiefschwarz in der Farbe, keine Blume (in Wroclaw vom Fass getrunken), voller Körper mit Backpflaume und Rosinen....

Pours black with a tan head. Coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malt, alcohol, caramel and vanilla aroma. Dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla, plum, roasted malt, caramel, toast and slight alcohol flavors. Full body and moderate carbonation and a chocolate, coffee and roasted malt finish with a hint of alcohol.

Helt svart med brunt skum som Ga fine gardiner ned gjennom hele glasset. Sterk duft av søt malt, tørket frukt, vanilje og hint av sherry. Smaken var umiddelbart ganske "boozy" etterfulgt av tørket frukt og noe kaffe. Tykk og oljete avslutning.

(Draught at Beer Temple, Amsterdam, 21 Feb 2016) Black colour with brief, foamy, beige head. Malty, roasted nose with strong sweet coffee, liquorice and caramel. Malty, roasted taste with notes of liquorice, strong black coffee, cacao, molasses, raisins, dark fruit and a generous roasty bitterness in the finish. Full body, thick and fairly oily mouthfeel. A certain sweetness. Solid and well made imperial porter in excellent balance for its strength. Lovely stuff!

Bottle.

A- Alcohol, sharpies, chocolate.

O- I had looked forward to this one only to take a sip and be whipped with a palate shocking abrasiveness. Maybe I just got a triple strength bottle or something but this was like liquid sharpie. Ive had smoother bourbon.
12oz bottle pours a thick black color with a bit of head. Lots of roasted malt and hops.
Black with creamy brown head. Vanilla, cherries, chocolate and banana. Sweet, dry and spicy finish. Overall: great aroma

Pours dark black with espresso color head. Aroma is filled with dar chocolate and vanilla. Taste is complex chocolate, caramel, vanilla and even some sourness from dark fruit. Really complex and interesting.

Bottle. Black body with tan head. Aroma is chocolate and cocoa with caramel and vanilla and also some alcohol. Taste ís chocolate and cocoa with hints of caramel and vanilla. Aftertaste is nice sweet and bitter. Nice one
This was very pleasant brew. Hight roastiness level. Some raisins, plums and chocolate. ABV is also quite nice. Loved it!

Bottle from Vinmonopolets BU. Pours very dark brown, close to black. Tiny brown head, doesnt even cover the entire surface. Alcohol, liquorice, wood nose. Very sweet, with balancing bitterness. Dark chocolate, caramel, vanilla, wood, coffee, red fruit, plum, liquorice flavour. Full, thich body. Soft carbonation. Good. Maybe a bit overwhelming. Best at room temperature!
black liquid with brown head. aroma of oak barrel, toffee, vanilla. taste is heavy sweet, light bitter, light sour, rye bread, chocolate, toffee. full body, oily, average carbonisation, long finish.

Refrigerated 12 oz. brown bottle poured into a snifter. Coal black with medium light brown head. Aroma is fudge, medium body, medium carbonation, and good small-bubble lacing. Taste is rich chocolate,  dark malt, some herbal hops, and some anise.

Tap @ Beer Temple, sample size. Black color, quite dense brown head, good retention. Aromas: roasted, sweet, red fruit, alcoholic. Retronasal its alcohol upfront, some acetone/spiritus even, roasted, red fruit, sweet. Flavor is rather sweet, fruity, roasted. Medium bodied. Finishes sweetish and with roast, which leads to a roasted bitter finish.
12 oz bottle pours black with a brown head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, toffee, fruit. Taste is coffee, licorice, chocolate and grain.

Bold imperial porter. Deep roasted malts, intense dark choco in coffee, strong dark dried fruits, quite vinous, nice wood touch, some licorice. Moderate sweet with moderate bitterness and light tartness. 
Very well balanced top level sipper

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2017 Pours black color, slightly haze, with creamy light brown stable head.
 Visually low to medium csrbonation. Aroma: intense dark malts aroma, with notes of coffee, vanilla, port wine, slightly woody, with fruity esters of dark fruits, forest berries, yoghurt etc.. 
Flavor is rich, creamy: prevails malt flavors, which takes on coffee, dark chocolate, supported with notes of molasses, port wine, cinnamon, fruity esters of hops, which takes on forest berries, dark fruits like prunes, dried fruits, etc. 
Mouthfeel is sticky sweet, alcohol warmth is evident and takes on port wine, finish is dry, sticky and slightly fruity bitters. Dryness lingers in aftertaste. Body is full, texture is soft, carbonation is low.

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2016 330ml bottle from Liberty Wine Merchants CD. Very rich aroma AND taste: vinous, sweet, dark fruits, plums, raisin, grape, sophisticated notes of alcohol. Superb balanced. Excellent beer.

Deep brown body, small brown head. Aroma of molasse, burned sugar, caramel, chocolate, dried fruits, blackcurrent, vanilla, licorice, alcohol fusel, bourbon like, some wood. Flavours of molasse, licorice, chocolate, wood, vanilla, alcohol fusels, dried fruits. Long licorice, woody, vanilla, choclate and warm finish. Long molasse aftertaste with some bitterness. Creamy body, low carbo. Outstanding.

12oz bottle - pours a thick midnight black with a very thin brown head. Great aroma of molasses, dark chocolate, licorice, black currant and bourbon like booziness. Intense and delicious flavors of roasted/charred grain, dark chocolate, molasses and some anise liqueur.

355cl bottle. Deep black colour with a thin tan head. Molasses, leather, cocoa, dark chocolate, wood, liquorice, raisins and roasted aroma. Soft carbonation and full body. Taste is quite complex with a lot of flavours rushing in. But more on the sweet side. Overall, a fantastic beer that has nothing lil.
Bardzo dobry, słodko-czekoladowo-śliwkowy porter w wersji hard. Myślę że w Polsce uplasowałby się gdzieś w połowie stawki :)
Calm, no foam. Fruity. Syrup! Extra full and sweet body. Luscious. Smooth. Thick and boozy, yet elegant. Xmas. Dessert delight.
Deep black with a tan head. Licorice and burnt sugars lend a delicious complexity to this beer. High alcohol dries up the finish.
Jet black, treacle pour with a thin lace. Strong roasted malt, boozy aroma. Flavour of fruit, chocolate, winter berry, liquorice and cherries. Silky texture Sweet and boozy.

(330ml bottle @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, Feb 5 2016) Pours inky black with a small tan head and no lace. Aroma is fairly sweet with molasses, burnt sugar, stewed dark fruits, light anise, a bit of chocolate sauce, some ash and tar for slight balance. Flavour is quite sweet, again riding a core of molasses and burnt sugar with chocolate, dark fruit, a bit of vanilla in there too, slight licorice. Towards the finish there is a bit of bitter cacao, burnt malt and ash but really low on roast overall. A bit of bitterness builds when warm, supported by alcohol heat. Medium full body, low carb, oily and smooth. Nice and rich, a bit sweet for me and not extremely complex, but a big dark sipping beer with low roast that seems to hit the notion of imperial porter on the head.

Crazy aroma, leather, wood, booze, dark fruit, raisins, sweet burnt caramel, its all over the place. Black body with a thin tan ring for a head. Flavor is just like the aroma different flavors constantly flowing about with a burnt, yet kinda mellow finish. Definitely unique and good.

Jet black beer with tanned head on it, altough head dont stay too long and have no lacing on the glass.
Aroma; very powerfull sweet, dark aroma, with chocolate, cocoa, licorie.
Taste: high sweetness with caramel and chocolate flavours, than hint of sour with dark fruit notes, and than light bitter that slowly builds up with some alcohol in it.
Palate: full body, pretty thick, with warming up alcohol, kinda spicy in bitter after warming up. 
Overall: good, sweet beer, pretty powerfull with it flavours, altough not that complex, definitly would get even better with age. I would love to try this barrel aged in bourbon barrels

Je ne sais pas trop à quel moment, limperial porter bascule vers la stout ? En tout cas, on y est presque ici, à ce point là. Bien réalisé ici mais avec un style plus piquant et acide que ce vers quoi mon goût me porte habituellement !
Dark brown body with a thin brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, alcohol. Taste is sweet and medium bitter. Full body, oily texture.

Ive never had an Evil Twin Brewing beer. They always seem to be a bit pricy for what Im looking for. However, I got $50 for my birthday and decided to give it a whirl. Picked Lil B over Christmas Eve at a New York Hotel Room and Soft DK. Heres to making the right choice.

Poured a black color with two fingers of dark tan, frothy head, which settled nicely on the top. Good amount of uneven, wet, foamy lacing on the sides of the glass. Very good retention. (Sight - 4.25)

Smelled some weird flavors off the get go, getting dark fruits - red apple, plum and purple grape - butterscotch, caramel, toffee, figs, dates, brown sugar and boozy molasses. Something a tad off. (Smell - 3.50)

Tasted better than the nose. Got smooth butterscotch, sugary caramel and toffee, maple syrup, brown sugar, licorice, molasses, leathery notes and dark red apple. So smooth. (Taste - 3.75)

Full body. Sticky texture. Average carbonation. Long, warming finish. (Feel - 4.75)

Overall I was disappointed in this one, although it did grow on me as it went down. I wonder how this would do with age. (Overall - 3.75)

3.82 86 B+

Thick black pour with a thin tan head. Lovely slick oily mouthfeel, with big treacle, brown sugar, burnt flavours. Hint of liquorice and stewed fruits. This is just what I like in a beer, really good.

The aroma is full of dried fruits (prunes among), chocolate, coffee, tar, rope, smoke and cocoa beans. The color is pitch black. The taste is full of chocolate, coffee, smoke, dried fruits, cocoa beans. What a lovely beer!

This beer has a silky black pour with a thin brown head. The aroma is of molasses, pretty spot on. Brown sugar. The flavor is potent. Lots of alcohol, initial burn. The body is sweet, some caramel, brown sugar, molasses. It has that molasses strong flavor. Interesting. Good.

On draft at Isaacs. Drank two with Junior and Bob. Amazing black as motor oil pour. Notes of licorice, dark roasted malts, molasses, dark fruit, possibly plumb , prunes and raisins. Had no idea it was 11%. WOW!!
Black colour, brown head. Aroma of dark fruits, cake, cotrusy notes. Taste is light to medium sweet. Medium to full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Very interesting porter.

A great way to spend a New Years Eve Day, potent to its core, Lil B is hardly little and punches above its weight. Boozy blasts of rummy fruitcake, chocolate and espresso, smoke and cigar roll off of this headless skull-shaker. The body is absolutely fantastic, syrupy yet not saccharine, allowing the flavours to meld and stretch out upon the tongue. A fine black brew for a wintry day.

Pours jet black with a nice tan head. Super toasty nose. chocolate cake, bitter chocolate, slight hint of booze. Burnt malt, roast malt, smoked malt...so much malt. As it warms some cocoa come through, strong bitter chocolate finish. Thick mouthfeel. Would mark it a lil b(it) higher if it wasnt as bitter as it is, but its still a really nice beer.
Thuis, fles van Biernavigatie. Alsof je een pot chocopasta leeg eet in slowmotion. Smoke m if you got m! Backlog from 2015/10/18.

Black color with a tan head with short duration. Aroma has notes of roasted malts, liquorice and ripe raisins. Flavor is slightly sweet, ripe dark fruit, burnt wood, light coffee, chocolate. Full bodied with a creamy and smooth mouthfeel. Really enjoyable!!!

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2016 Pretty Genuine. Aroma is alcohol, dark fruits. Not too good-looking: head is minimal and dissappears quickly. Taste is equilibrated, tends to be sweet. Almost tastes like red sweet wine. Overall, pretty great experience.
Draught. Creamy lightbrown good mostly lasting head. Black colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Heavy bitter flavor. Long heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate. Nice.

I really like this. Huge power and complexity, with a sweetness that moves it in the quad direction. Which works for me. Very dark brown with a hint of red, and chocolate coloured head which sadly fades very quickly. Full, glossy body. Not so much of the typical coffee and chocolate, but you get plums, prunes, raisins, nuts, molasses, treacle, red berries and licqorice. Excellent.

Bottle. Very dark brown - almost black, small to average and fully diminishing dark brown head. Moderate, malty and sweetish aroma, some roasted malt and coffee, light licorice and hoppyness. Body is medium to full, malty and sweetish flavor, some roasted malt and light coffee, light hoppyness and faint alcohol. Finish is average to long, malty and sweetish, some roasted malt - faint burnt malt, some coffee and faint licorice, - light - some hoppyness, light alcohol. Sweetish and roasted strong porter. Nice but way too sweet for me.
355ml bottle @ Chez Sophie, Shrewsbury. Pours pitch black, menacing tan head. Aroma is dried fruits, chocolate. Taste is unctious, plummy dark fruits and molasses. Serious stuff.

Aroma - Sweet, malty, plum.

Bottle 0,33. Black with a little brown head. Sweet and malt,smell like belgian beer, roasty. Taste is malt, sweet, roast, dark bitter chocolate, a little dry fruit. Aftertaste is bitter with sweetness. Good, but not amazing.

330ml bottle (thanks martjoobolut). Very dark brown color. Medium size, beige head, stays. Sour, roast, acetone, lime, sweet in aroma. Sweet, roast, chocolate, alcohol, woody in taste. Sweet and boozy and unbalanced and messy. Typical Evil Twin. Seems that I dont like sweet boozy messes from Evil Twin.

355ml bottle - thanks martjoobolut
Sweet sweaty feet. Sticky palate. What is this? Roast malts, but raw and sweet. Not sure they bothered fermenting this. Vapours are weird, not quite mentholy, but something light. Fuck, this bummed my high.

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2015 Bottle. Pours black with brown head. Aroma is sweet, roast, malt, fruits. Flavor is sweet, fruits, raisins, malt, roast, dark chocolate. Finish is roast bitter with sweetness and some dryness. Overall: good, but somewhat underwhelming.

Black beer, small brown head. Nose is fruity, coffee, chocolate, mint and roast notes. Flavor is roast, licorice, fruit, sweetness, finish is mint candy, roast, chocolate. Lingering minty roast. Minty, but not in a good way.

Medium beige Head, Woody Roasted Aroma, full Body and mouthfeel, Oak Aged Whisky notes, all
In all an Impressive Beer!

Pours an opaque darkest brown ever with a nice tan head that remains throughout. Aroma is roasted coffee and dark fruit. Taste is sweet dark roasted malt, licorice, coffee, molasses and prunes. ABV goes completely un-noticed. Excellent.

355ml bottle enjoyed @ home. Pours pitch black with a small beige head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, milk chocolate, coffee, caramel, brown sugar, wood and alcohol. Flavour is light to medium bitter and medium sweet. Full bodied, oily texture, average to soft carbonation. Finish is roasted, sweet and warming alcogol.
