(bottle) clear very dark brown colour with a small brown head; aroma of roast, then soy sauce, stewed fruit, milk chocolate, jam; rich, balanced flavour with a short light bitter and long light sour finish; well hidden alcohol; thick palate

W aromacie czekolada, ciemne ciasto bananowe (trochę szok) likier kawowy, świetny, pełny i niezwykle apetyczny. W smaku podobnie, większy nacisk na czekoladę niż banany, choć i te są obecne, gładkie, świetnie ukryty alkohol, świetne piwo!

So brown with a slight head. Aroma is dark make, slight cherry or dark fruit. Taste is creamy, alcohol well hidden, somewhat boring I guess.. Really good but doesnt really have a ton going on. Cost is of course ridiculous.

Pours inky black with a coffee coloured head that dissipates quickly. Aromas of chocolate, roasted malt and coffee. Sweet and rich to taste, smoky chocolate. Incredible mouth-feel. A really well rounded imperial porter!

Bottle. Sensoric. Pitch black with medium, densed, light brown head. Poor head retention...... Aroma is complex, mainly dominated by honey-like sweetness (caramel/burnt sugar) together with medium dark fruits (plums, raisins) and woody aromas. Alos light touch of booze and liquorice. Taste is semi-sweet to sweet, lightly bitter in the end. Full body, oily and creamy texture, medium carbonation, finish is little astringent, light to medium bitter and woody. Slightly alcohol warming. Nice and drinkable imperial porter with strong sweet accents slightly balanced with bitterness.

12 oz bottle from Bishops Cellar. Pours an inky black colour with small mocha-coloured head. Aroma is full of dried dark fruit, caramel, cocoa and licorice. Flavour is big raisin and prune, caramel, toffee, dark chocolate, licorice and tobacco. Some booziness. Slick, oily moutfeel. Minimal carbonation. Impressive one.

355 ml bottle bought at Little Beer Shop in SoHo, Central.
Looks: Very deep Cola-blackish brown colour; Less than one-quarter finger head and residual soapy dark beige foam which fades in 15 seconds. Good sticky lacing and zero carbonation.

Aroma: Quite fragrant and sweet dark malt, with strong rum-like alcohol, strong raisins, plums, sugar, dark chocolate, caramel, toffee, cream, light coffee, light lemon and faint grass.

Taste: Pleasant, very strong sweet dark malt, with fairly strong roastyness, very strong rum-like alcohol, burnt toast, strong caramel, sugar syrup, dark chocolates, black coffee, strong plums, dark fruits, assorted berries, dark cherries, liquorices, yeast, lime, moderate bitter hops and grass. 

Body: Close to full body. Thick and oily palate.

Mouth Feel: Wholesome maltyness in a very thickish background. Nicely roasted with initial burnt toasts. Syrupy booze with moderate liqiorices, thick but not cloying, like a liquor. Followed by strong caramel, dark chocolates, strong dark fruits and berries, especially raspberry and dark cherries. Ended with yeast and limey hops. Layered and intense. Nice!

Hoppiness: light lemon and faint grass in nose. Strong lime and grass in taste. Bitterness is moderate, barely matched with strong booze for a lasting, syrupy sweet bitter finish.

After Taste: Slightly dry. Very Sweet and boozy to mouth.

Comments: This is a very nice and headstrong Imperial Porter, with intense aroma and favour in fruity berries, rum booze, caramel and chocolates. Layered, warm and rather straight forward, a very neat sipper by all means, Ill like it even more if its a little slimmer. : )

Prune, walnut, and almond nose. Black viscous pour, virtually headless. Prunes, tobacco, walnut, and horehound. Elderberry, when quaffed. Almond, vanilla, and charred oak finish. Full body, chewy, moderate carbonation. Deep, dark, intense, and complex. Fabulous beer, would love to try it from a cask.

Tap at roundhouse, hong kong. Black color, some head. Aroma is full of hops and roasted malts. Chocolste and coffee, nearly perfect. Smooth and balanced, full of chocolate and coffee. Its piece of art.

Bottled: Pours black with a thick head. Aroma is lots of sweet licorice, some smoked meat and a touch of Parmesan cheese(!). Smooth mouth feel. The taste is all about sweet licorice leading to a warming alcohol finish.

Pours black with low brown head
Aromas vinouos, coffee, molasses, dried fruits
Taste has nice notes of molasses, chocolate, brown sugar, hints of vanilla, 
Creamy mouthfeel, medium to high sweetness with low bitterness
Bottle from Mikkeller Bottle Shop - black pour with tan head. Roasted and sweet malty aroma and taste, chocolate and caramel sweetness, some coffee, toasty burnt notes, roasted finish.

Pite na Beer Geek Pumpkin we Wrocławiu. Aromat mega. Intensywny. Czuć łychę, generalnie słodki. Poza tym czekolada. Dominuje czerwona pomarańcza, albo inaczej - dojrzałe jabłko, czerwone. Gęsta brązowa piana. Obfita, dosyć trwała. Barwa piwa - czarna. W smaku MA-SA-KRA. Mega czekolada z orzechami. Pralinki, grejpfrut, kawa. Delikatnie grzejący alkohol, ale zdecydowanie nie czuć voltarzu tego piwa. Średnio-wysokie nagazowanie. Piwo pełne, oleiste. Mega gładkie. Goryczka średnia, obecna gdzieś w tle. Piwo super, świetnie ułożone.
On tap at Christian Firtal. Black with a small tan head. Aroma of caramel, licorice and soy sauce. Sweet toffee malty flavour with dark sugar, molasses and soy sauce.

12oz bottle. Thick mollasses opaque black body. Rusty beige head, steadily lines the glass. Rather worthless deScription doesnt help to know what it going on in this beer. One...it tastes a little suspiciously extract boosted to me. Two...what do you mean changed? Was this licorice barrel aged or something? Really does maintain some semblance of porterhood, even if it is a big oily sweet sugary mess of a beer. Raisin, licorice, brown chocolate, syrup. Not that bad, but I probably wouldnt buy this again..screams unauthentic. Very little subtlety or grace, surprisingly little malt depth.

Bière noire comme la nuit au-dessus de laquelle flotte une mince couche de mousse, épaisse lors du service mais rapidement fondue. Les arômes évoluent fortement au fil des Celsius qui augmentent. Plus froide, la bière était beaucoup sur la pacanne au beurre et la croustade aux pommes. Au fil des Celsius, beaucoup dalcool, de la mélasse, des pruneaux séchés et un gâteau au fruits qui me rappelle vaguement du Grand Marnier. Nez évolutif très intéressant! En bouche le liquide est assez mince et donc très facile à boire. Lalcool devient beaucoup plus subtile mais je suis toujours dans ces notes de mélasse mais cette fois avec un léger goût de vanille qui me rappelle un alcool chaud américain. Moyennement longue, cette bière se boit parfaitement en accompagnement dun baklava aux amandes.
Pours black with a small brown head. Aroma is coffee, smoke and dark fruit taste follows nos

Copenhagen 14/10 2015. 50 cl from draft at Søernes Ølbar. Pours dark brown - almost pitch black - with small beige head. Dissapears fairly fast. Aroma is sugary and quite potent with alcohol. Soft carbonation and thicky and sticky palate. Taste is quite sweet. Chocolate and prunes treated with sugar. Sort of unbalanced on the sweet side. Kinda reminds me of hot beer with whipped cream. Not sure if that is a compliment.

Bottle tall boys beer market. Black slight head. Aroma is nice choc plums raisins taste same great sweetness lots of fruicake choc nice dark malts slight alcohol warmth good long bitter finish. So easy to drink no sign of abv. Great mouthfeel perfect carbonation. Top draw this amazing stuff.

Pours a thin tan head on a black body.
The aroma is subtle and complex: licorice, burnt wood, honey, roasted malt, coffee, molasses and dark chocolate.
The taste starts with mild cocoa sweetness, a little coffee bitterness, then more sweetness and cream.
The texture is soft and smooth.
Excellently balanced flavors. Too easy to drink for the ABV.
Bottle. Deep brown with a light brown lasting head. Roasted malts, milk chocolate, biscuit and marshmallow. Oreo cookie flavor with a dry roast finish. Heavy body with a foamy feel.
Bottle @ Vinoble, Odense. Pours black with a creamy Brown head. Sweet honey and hard roast. Soy and syrup. Slick and oily. Great sipper!

Aroma is lots of dark fruit, raisins, sweet malt, complex. Appearance is dark brown, dark khaki head, poured pretty thick. Taste is crazy, complex, starts with dark fruit and finishes with roasted malt. Burnt caramel, maybe. Getting some vanilla after it lingers. Real nice. Mouthfeel is thick, soft carbonation and lots of flavor. Overall, this is very well done.

Appearance: opaque black with one finger of dense mocha head demising gradually to a thin skim, no lacing. (4/5) Aroma: boozy dark fruit, liquorice, coffee, burnt sugar. (7/10) Taste: moderately strong sweet, moderate bitter. (7/10) Palate: full slightly oily body, low carbonation, warming bitter finish. (4/5)

A little hot initially, but it mellows nicely as the taste buds numb. OK, that may be a little unfair - its actually a pretty smooth imperial porter, but the ABV presence is certainly emphatic, verging on solvent. Decent complexity of flavours on the nose and the tongue. Definitely not subtle. (15/20)

Bottle. Pours pitch black with tan creamy head. Aroma has tobacco, very sweet, brown burn sugar, raisins, sherry and port. Taste is sugary, puddersukker, port, dark fruits, dark rich chocolate, cocoa, coffee, chocolate milk. Malty and fudge. Finish is malty and toasty and full creamy body. Dry cocoa powder. Well done.
Aromat fajny: słody karmelowe, kakao kawa, troche lukrecji. Smak: gładki o kremowej konsystencji, słodka czekolada, lekkie gorzkie nuty kawy, i wiśnie.
355ml bottle. Dakr black pour, nail polish remover/acetone int eh aroma, flavor is same but worse, epic mess.

Bottle from bishops. Pours coffee black with leather tan head and minimal lacing. Nose is vanilla. Flavours of vanilla, bourbon, dark chocolate dark fruit. Taste is huge sweet and big bitter. Full creamy mouth with medium carbonation. Nice beer!
No aroma but very smooth taste. Hints of chicory. Wife tastes licorice. Little head. Once again, smooth. A dangerous 11.5% beer. Bottle.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2015 Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. This is an inky black beer that pours with a large foamy dark brown head which unfortunately rapidly disappears. It has a very rich cherry, plum and vanilla flavour, oak and leather notes with more boozy sweet red fruit on the oily finish. Pretty good but a bit to high in its ABV for me. However drinking it on day 2, it has a slightly smoother edge to the flavours. Better.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2015 Rerate:
Dark brown black color, small medium brown head, with sporadic strands of oily lacing. Aroma has nice chocolaty cocoa, caramel malts, and strong vanilla notes. Flavor is extraordinary, super smooth, cocoa, malts, minimal bitterness, sweet and sticky. This is the best imperial porter Ive ever had. Its more mellow than an imperial stout, which can be so overbearing its not enjoyable. Theres no bitterness or crazy booziness here, its just so smooth- like a good imperial stout thats been aged already for 5 years. Im buying another 4pk tomorrow.

8/3/15, (7)(4)(8)(4)(1 4
Dark brown black color with almost no head, just a tiny thin medium brown ring, with faint messy lacing. Aroma has nice caramel, cocoa malts. Flavor is smooth and creamy, sweet chocolate, light bitter coffee notes, chewy toffee. Mouthfeel is thick and oily leaving my lips sticky. So very good!

Draught. Pours pitch black, white small head. Aroma of roasted malts, caramel, dark chcolate, cofee, dried, fruits and unfortunately strong aldehyde which completely ruins greatness of the rest aroma. In taste sweet, quite roasty with dark chocolate. Dried fruits flavours. Here aldehyde is not so strong, yet still noticable. Full bodied, sweet finished with medium bitterness. Alcohol well hidden.
Bottle sample at a tasting at Tempo. Thanks Tom L. Black. Rich, deep aroma, of prune and liquor. Rich, liquor-like taste. Smooth texture, no carbonation, full body, long finish.

330 ml bottle from Club de Cervezas, Chile. Pours a pitch black color and, after a vigorous pour, just a small light brown head and a medium lacing. Aroma is densely malty with loads of chocolate, dark fruits, prunes, dates, licorice, Port Wine and burnt sugars. Intense stuff. Taste is sweet with some umami touches. Strong burnt sugars and chocolate can be felt throughout the whole mouthfeel without the slightest roasty bitterness or astringency. Maybe slightly too sweet for my taste. Bold and a little bit boozy, very warming. Oily texture, low carbonation. This is heavy stuff. A nice Imperial Porter, good sipper. The 330 ml bottle might be excessive for some.
Looks fine, dark with the tan head but this beer is just so sweet that I did not enjoy it at all. The sweetness actually even let the alcohol become present. I did not enjoy this

Bottle @ home w friends/the chef. Appearance: clear black with ok off-white soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: caramel, raisins, dark fruits, chocolate and some ash. palette: strong malty and fruity aroma, average carbonation, medium to full body, distinct sweetness, balanced by a medium to strong bitterness, long duration and an oily texture. Overall: nice powerful porter.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Tempo. Thanks Tom L. 2014 bottle, 9.8%. Black with a bit of light brown foam. Aroma of chocolate, cherries, plums, some alcohol. Sweet flavor with chocolate, dark fruits (lots of plums), a sourish note, and a bit of alcohol. Full-bodied. Really good.
Bottle. Color black with small brown head. Aroma roasted, chocolate malt. Taste sweet, roasted, chocolate, bitter finish.
(bottle - 12 oz) Dark black pour with no head. Shockingly mild aroma but hints of dark fruits and coffee. Flavor is very dark as well. Lots of bitter burnt malts and coffee. Good alcohol punch.

Bottle into a tulip. Pours black, with a moderate brown head. Minimal lacing. Nose is dark roast malt, coffee, and dark fruit. Taste is complex, with notes of chocolate, coffee, and dark roast malt. Very creamy mouth feel, and a long, smooth finish. Outstanding.
Pours pitch black with small brown head that quickly dissapears. Aromas of sweet malt, burnt sugar and coffee. Super smooth, velvety. Dark malt, caramel. Wonderful imperial porter.

From the tap (Bierfest Göttingen) - very creamy and smooth like jazz. I think this is the best american imperial porter that i ever had. Very complex aroma and taste. High bitterness for a porter but still good.

355ml bottle from Mikkeller Bottle Shop Copenhagen. Dark brown / black with a compact fluffy tan head. Malt aroma, caramel sweetness, bitter chocolate, roasted malt. Creamy, thick mouth feel. Rich flavor, hot chocolate with whipped cream and marshmallow, maple syrup, dried dark fruit. Deep, rich and sweet flavors.

Bottle 12fl oz (Biercraft)
Opaque black color, small brownish head. Heavy sweet and somewhat toasted aroma. Full-bodied. Very sweet, almost honeyish flavor. Covers alcohol quite a bit. Calvados, some roasty bitterness in the aftertaste. Way too sweet for my liking although quite complex.

12 oz. bottle, at home. Aroma: Sugar cone; vanilla extract; chocolate fudge; light bourbon-like impressions. Appearance: Inky black pour with a mocha cap that fades into a ring. Flavor: Understated fudge and sugar cone up front, and then sugars, sugars, sugars with vanilla extract accompaniment, leading to a lingering vanilla finish. Not terribly boozy for its strength. Palate: Full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, lingering finish. Overall: The kind of really sweet, dessert-like beer that I get in the mood for now and then. If I had another bottle, Id probably make a beer float with some vanilla bean ice cream, or go full Kentucky and have it with Transparent Pie.

Bottle - Rich bitter chocolate and lots of dark fruit. Jet black with a light brown head. Dark chocolate, dark fruit and a syrupy mouthfeel. Light bitterness and lots of sweetness in the finish. Nice.

12 oz bottle pours a black color with a nice white head. Aromas of dark fruit, coffee, sweet dark roasted malt. Full bodied and delicious

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2015 Tap @basement beer bar. Aroma of brown sugar and dark fruits. Black with tan head, none lasting. Heavy sweetness, some alcohol sweetness. Full body, smooth texture, average carbonation, sweet roasted finish.

Aroma: roasted malts, molasses, coffee, chocolate
Appearance: clear black, slight brown head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, dark fruit, chocolate
Palate: full body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Excellent Impy porter

355ml bottle. Had this sitting in the cupboard a couple of years. Pours an opaque black with very dark brown head. Aroma is charcoal, burnt toast, roasted Malt, booze and dark fruit. Taste is really smoky. Really thick texture. Chewy, boozy finish mixed with treacle.
bottle. Thick black with minimal head. The ABV comes across strong, but theres plenty of flavor as well. Chocolate and licorice malts, bitter hops. Definite sipper.

Pours an extremely dark brown/black with a very dark brown head. Malty aroma with toasted/caramel notes. Deep, rich flavor with hints of coffee and mild sweetness. Very full body with minimal carbonation. Goes down a little thick, but without being too much so. An absolutely fantastic porter, one of the better beers Ive had.

Bottle @ Home. Pours black with a fading creamy brown head, lacings. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, caramel, licorice, marcipan, alcohol. Flavor is sweet malty, caramel, sweet chocolate, lightly burned brown sugar, sweet / tart dark fruit, plum in madaira, marcipan, alcohol. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, light sweet finish with warming alcohol. 090515

Taster at Beer for Geeks. It is an inky black pour and has a deep roasty plum chocolate aroma. Medium bodied, the taste is molasses, maple and chocolate syrup. Not so complex and maybe a bit too sweet but well done.

Pours pitch black. Nice head. Aroma: chocolate, sweet coffee, plums. Taste: raisins, chocolate and tons of coffee, with nice alcoholic warming in the palate. Very nice RIS, pretty sweet but it was not disturbing me.

On tap at WFDP 2015. Black beer with almost brown head. Complex aromas of chocolate, molasses, dark fruits, dried plums etc. Very sweet, like chocolate liqueur. Smooth, creamy, full bodied beer. Very interesting, although a bit too sweet for me.

Negra, espuma marrom abundante, de longa duração, linda! Aroma de café, chocolate amargo, alcoólica, torradas, adocicada, couro. Paladar de dulçor médio, alcoólica, amargor discreto que intensifica no aftertaste. Corpo médio. Aftertaste intenso de café e álcool, toffe, doce de leite, chega a lembrar sabor defumado. Cerveja complexa e deliciosa!

Tallahassee, Fl - Quick Save - 12 oz bottle. Deep dark brownish-black pour, light, mocha colored head that clings to the edge of the glass. Prune-like fruitiness, a touch of chocolate, some dates and raisins in the aroma. Flavor is decadent with some chocolate goodness, some date-like fruity notes, some strong liqueur notes - cognac comes to mind. Thick, creamy mouthfeel. Excellent night cap.
I love porters. this is pretty good. it has a smooth start. the finish I am not sure about. its got a bit of alcohol sting.

Luscious opaque black with a mocha head. Aroma is cacao with some sherry and licorice. Flavor is rich cocoa with capuchino and a hint of orange marmalaed. Short aftertaste, easy drinking rich palate, alcohol very well conceieved.

Almost black dark brown color that eliminates all light that bombards the brew. Mild aroma of molasses, alcohol, sugar, and chocolate. Really complex and well balanced flavor that entices the palate. Incredibly smooth and thick with a creamy mouthfeel that was fantastic. Overall, a sweet porter that was truly a treat.

(on tap at BGM2, sample) Black, untransparent colour. Brown, small, stable head. Syrupy texture, full body, low carbonation. Aroma: Dark malts, dark fruits, berrys, sweet cherries, chocolate. Taste: Sweet, sweet milk chocolate, cocoa. Very long, chocolate finish. Very tasty, mayby a bit too sweet.
Ok, so the aroma is a bit mild, but the taste is so balanced and with a hint of salt to add intrigue - perfect! And the palate, ditto. Fabulous beer!

Beczka, 0,2 l, Wrocław, zaklęte Rewiry. Aromat czekoladowy, wiśnie w czekoladzie, śliwki. Bardzo przyjemny i intensywny. Piana głęboko beżowa, gęsta, bardzo drobna, trwała i wspaniale zdobiąca szkło. Barwa bardzo czarna, niemal czarna. Smak: czekolada, likier czekoladowy z owocami jak w aromacie. Odczucie w ustach: gęste, aksamitne z wyczuwalnym szlachetnym alkoholem. Ogólnie: świetny porter imperialny.

0.2 from a tap. Black in color with a small, brown head. Aroma seems quite bitter, has floral notes in it, obvious malts, a whole lot of fruits (some fermented), some prunes, and advocaat. Taste is also fruity, sweetnsour, malts are more delicate, syrup, and again some advocaat though this time more of a cognac than egg. Medium body, thick texture, and soft carbonation. Finish is fruity, alcoholic, and features fermented apples. Overall not a bad beer but certainly not very drinkable.
From tap in Torst, NYC. Perfect look, perfect mouth feel. Beer is very thick, very dense. Really awesome.

Spokojnie można to piwo umieścić w top 3 najlepszych piw jakie piłem w swoim całym życiu:) Mega intensywny aromat śliwek, wiśni, migdałów. Dość słodkie. W smaku alkohol zupełnie niewyczuwalny ( A ma 11.5%!). Arcydzieło piwowarstwa.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2016 BGM2 z kranu za 16zl 0,2l. W aromacie i w smaku dojrzałe czarne wisnie w czekoladzie, kawa, palonoe slody, delikatne sliwki wegierki. W odczuciu bogate i roznorodne, tresciwe, polskodkie - taki "podkrecony" porter baltycki.

Z butelki - jeszcze smaczniejszy:
Piana brązowa, sycząca, szybko opada do zera. Barwa czarna, nieprzejrzysta. Aromat przyjemny, są ciemne owoce (jeżyny, jagody, borówki amerykańskie, ciemne winogrono), wiśnie w czekoladzie, kawa, w tle wędzone śliwki węgierki... W smaku półsłodkie, powtórka tego, co w aromacie z większym udziałem wędzonych śliwek i paloności. Goryczka średnia do niskiej. W afterteasie wanilia i tytoń. Alkohol perfekcyjnie ukryty, nie ma tu nawet likierowego odczucia! Wysycenie średnie do niskiego, treściwe, pełne, lekko wyklejające w odbiorze. Na ustach i języku, przez chwilę po połknięciu, pozostaje również fajna mineralność.
Rewelacyjny Porter, łagodniejszy, gładszy od RISa, z całym spektrum ciemnych owoców, świetnie zbalansowany. Klasa piwo!

Ps.
Gdyby tak smakowały polskie Portery Bałtyckie... ehh...

Bottle. Black, nice frothy tan head. Chocolate dry soft sweet ashy, dark berry nose. Quite malty, definitely more porter- like than RISsy. Some ethanol shining through though. Blackberries, some blueberries too, quite alive, mashed fruits really. Malty dustyness. Med full bodied, smooth slick. A bit boozy, but not too disturbingly. Easy drink nontheless, soft bittered, nicely sweet, yummy. A quickly dissapating sipper.

Smell of black chocolate and roasted malt. Hint of alcohol
In mouth its very tasteful. Cocoa, anise and expresso. Aromas of dark berries give a light sour side. High abv is well-hidden. Medium/high roundness. Low carbonation. 
Bitterness is quite long and dominated by anise.
Very good overall. Great complexity and well balanced.

Not sure if its a Stout or a Porter. Thick and with a alcohol boost. Chocolate, toffee, banana, orange peel, cheesecake are the dominating aromas. Mouthfeel is thick like a cream. It has a fine fresh roasted coffee flavor to it. Its also a bit too cloying sweet and difficult to drink.

Draft at Munich Tap House, 23rd March 15. This smells ok, a little boozy, however the taste is rough, overly sweet, sickly medicinal mess. Not much character to it and overtly strong ABV. Over rated, and a poor example of a porter

Dark brown-black body, medium to thin tan head, sparse lacing. Dark fruits, bittersweet chocolate, a little licorice, light roast, and a shit ton of syrupy booze. Full bodied, oily mouthfeel, with gentle carbonation, thick finish, sweet throughout.

Pours an extraordinarily dark brown with a short mochaccino froth colored head. Chocolate, fruit, and faint coffee aromas. Nothing "imperial" about the nose. Viscous and chewy. Metallic at the beginning. Man, I hope that fades as it warms. Fruit dominates, Cadbury chocolate, and faint coffee. Fruit expresses more at the very front and again at the finish.

12oz bottle. Dated about a year ago. Pours black. Just black. Small tan head, no lacing. Aroma is like a barleywine; also, banana and plenty of roasted malt. Flavor... wow. The flavor! It has everything. Roasted malt, banana, toffee, chocolate, slight sour funk, ash can, red berries. Body is substantial, mouthfeel is creamy, carbonation is fine and sharp. This is undoubtably the best dark beer Ive had as of 3/19/2015, and maybe the best beer, too.
From tap. Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, chocolate, bread, sweetness, dried fruit, cocao and alcohol.

330ml, 11.5%, bottled Oct 2013. Black, small foamy brown head. Aroma is chocolate, red berry, raspberry. Body is medium, slightly foamy, tingly carbonation. Taste is soft toffee malts, tangy berry, sweet seaweed, bacon, ashy. Tasty and interesting.

Bottle. Pours a dark brown color with a thick tan head that lasts. Aroma of roasted malt, dark fruit and bit of nut. Taste of roasted malt, dark fruit with nuts. Good bitterness and a dry finish. Full body, thick and creamy, robust character with very little hint of the 11.5% ABV. Very enjoyable beer.
Poetry in a bottle, liquid masterpiece. Hazelnut, licorice, Brown sugar, barley... Very good porter. My all time favourite

Keg at Brewdog, Shepherds Bush, London. A black coloured pour with a medium beige head on top. Rich, boozy, roasty, malty, sweet aroma. Tastes similar, rich, boozy, roasty, malty, sweet, slight coffee.

Pours with a thick caramel coloured head. Fruity molasses aroma. This beer has incredible depth & flavour - like a liquid chocolate fondant with a thick, caramel finish.

Rated by BrewTom

12 oz bottle from BOTW (Rochester), served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass. 
App.: Deep brown-black with a reasonable mocha head.
 
Aroma: Very deep and dark with a distinct savoury (beef broth/gravy) note, a little dark chocolate, molasses, light licorice, boozy, dark cherries, a bit peppery, after a while that savoury note disappears and the more common Impy Stout/Porter notes shine.
 
Palate: Medium-full body, slightly aggressive carbonation, syrupy.
 
Flav.: Lots of deep/dark malt, molasses, dark chocolate, a little black coffee, alcohol, un-fermented syrup, sweet; quite sweet with decent bitterness, plenty of alcohol and a dark chocolate, cacao, under-fermented thing.

Not great.
Bottle from Janes Beer Store, Mountain View, CA. Aroma of dark fruit, coffee. Super dense taste of dark fruit, molasses, and some roasted grains. Bitter finish.
Sweet, big porter. Black pour, minimal khaki head. Chocolate, coffee, earthy aroma. Taste was really sweet, slightly fruity sweet. Coffee was abound as well. Light bit of booze. Really good.
On tap at Tørst, Brooklyn. Pours dark brown with lasting brown head. Roasted, malty, chocolate aroma. Sweet, roasted chocolate flavor with dry bitter finish. Full bodied.

Bottle. Black with a beige head. Aromas are earthy with coal and rich coffee. Nutty with cola and peppery alcohol. Oily with dark toffee and blackberries. Floral with tobacco and dark cherries. Dark chocolate with toffee and medicinal notes. Flavours are sweet toffee and bittersweet dark chocolate with berries and cherry cola. Rich coffee with peppery alcohol and an oily palate. Some hints of smoky meatiness with earthy soy. Spicy on the finish. Excellent.
Pours black. Aroma and taste are sweet with dark fruits, chocolate, and roasted malts.
Sweet, malty, chocolate, coffee, heavy and velvety on the palate, minimal carbonation
Negra igual café. Melhor porter que já tomei. Dulçor prevalecendo sobre amargor. Alcool bem inserido. Só se sente quando levanta da cadeira. Recomendada.
Agreed its a porter with the punch of a barley wine. A strong dry malt with dried fruits, chocolate and coffee in a dark, oily flow of alcoholic warmth.

Dark with medium head. Olives and alcohol on the nose. Coffee, roasted apples and nice lingering alcohol in the end. Medium sweetness with a very nicely balanced biterness in the after taste. The body is spectacular, you almost feel like drinking oil. Absolutely amazing beer!

Coloração negra opaca (SRM30).

Espuma marrom clara, perene, com microbolhas de permeio, de alta formação e longa duração, deixando belos laços permanentes nas laterais do copo. (ap5/5).
 
Aroma é uma belo mix de milk shake de chocolate ao leite, com chocolate amargo, maltes torrados, frutas escuras (uva, ameixa, nozes, avelã), notas de frutas vermelhas ao fundo, bem sutis. 

Sabor inicialmente amargo e torrado, logo amaciado pelo dulçor e cremosidade do chocolate ao leite e pelo frutado das frutas escuras. Sendo que esse dulçor é muito suave, nada enjoativo. Seus 11,5% passam totalmente desapercebido, neste conjunto. Realmente, só me dei conta que tinha esse teor alcoólico, quando fui anotar no untappd. Final bem carregado no malte. Retrogosto torrado e achocolatado.

Textura cremosa-licorosa.

Carbonatação média/baixa e corpo médio/alto.

Um exemplar magnifico, com alta drinkability. Excelente presente. Caiu para mim como uma luva, perfeita para mim.

One of my favorite beers with complex aroma with cereal coffe. Appearece like petroleum with minimal dark brown. heavy sour and a full body very oily texture flat carbonation and a long finish like a good cigarret

Bottle at home. Pitch black colour, nicely stable brown creamy head. Interesting nose and taste with sweet roasted malts, coffee and chocolate, molasses, caramel, dried fruits (raisins, dades, figs, plums), aromatic hops and sweet red portowine tones too. Big alcoholic warmth when entering the lingering long finish. Medium carbonation, full body with big flavours, soft mouthfeel. Barley wine meets porter.

Dark black, no light going through, with a tiny mocha lacing. Quite complex, molasses, ripe dark fruit, roasted, chocolate, alcohol, coffee, dark caramel. Taste is mainly sweet, a little bitterness to balance everything greatly. Creamy with a medium to full body, everlasting aftertaste.
Deep, dark, sweet aftertaste. Nice alcohol bite. I can only drink 1, but this is more like food than libation.

12oz bottle in Seattle. Dark but not too thick, and a small tan ring head. Molasses and soy on nose, rich body is sweet with fruit and dry bitter chocolate. Some roastiness, and dry-bitter hop bite is terrific, balancing the sweet fruit and alcohol. Tasty big beer.
Bottle at Delirium. Dark and roasty, black treacle, caramel aroma. Taste is similar, lots of booze, full roast, coffee but also something creamy. Fruity and boozy. Good stuff.

Verre de dégustation, provenant dune bouteille, au Saint-Bock (Montréal, QC) gracieuseté du serveur. Arôme: Odeur de chocolat avec une pointe de caramel. Apparence: La couleur est noire opaque. Présence dun mince col beige mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de chocolat et de céréales grillées avec une pointe de caramel. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement chocolaté. (Rating #6059)

12 oz. bottle, opaque black, mahogany head fades. Aroma raisin and molasses, metal, cherry, soy. Taste is maraschino cherries, dried plums, molasses, coffee, spice, tobacco, roasted barley. Palate is rich, not syrup, carbonation moderate. This is sweet, but roasty with a bitter finish, and the transition is very nice, layered and changing. Best thing Ive had in days. It is a tad hot. Time in the cellar might turn this into something amazing.

Bottle: Pitch black pour with a smooth, burnt tan head that lathers up nicely & perches itself up top for a while. Big aroma of chocolate candies, burnt brown sugar, molasses, cookie dough, black cherries, hints of coffee, roasted malt, raisins, mild sweet cream, sticky caramel, & a touch of alcohol. Wow, lots going on. Flavor is very sweet up front. Huge residual brown sugar, toffee, caramel, & chocolate bursting at the seams. Underlying notes of roast, soy sauce, prunes, licorice, & mild ash lead into a chocolate brownie & molasses finish, stroked with a large ping of alcohol heat. Creamy body. A big beer, an intense beer. Perhaps just a touch on the overly sweet side at times, but otherwise this is pretty good.

Black opaque color, brown head. Aromas of liqourice, chocolate, roasted notes. Taste is really nice and sweet, with plums, raisins, chocolate, some roasted, maybe some smoke. Aftertaste is sweet and long. Medium to full body with medium carbonation.

(draught) black colour with a creamy brown head. aroma of cherries, toasted malts and ash, with a hint of brown sugar, some very light peat smoke, lots of sugar icing, alcohol, banana and müsli. flavour is mostly roasted malts and cornflakes, very boozy, with notes of fudge, light milk chocolate, treebark and coffee. heavy-bodied with soft carbonation.

Complete black color with a fine beige head. Nice lacing. Rich aroma with wood, chocolate and coffee. Thick oily body with a soft carbonation. Rich flavor with chocolate, coffee, wood and molasses. Tasty little devil.[Bottle from Mikkeller and Friends Bottleshop in Copenhagen, Denmark]

A malty big alchohol taste. 
  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a medium brown frothy head atop an opaque black body. Nose of soya sauce and molasses. Very roasty - even burnt - malt backing with a molasses and cocoa front. Somewhat dry. Interesting. Purchased at Metro Liquors University Heights.

From tap. Looks nice, black with brown head. In aroma coffee, chocolate, roasty, dark bread. Taste mainly coffee and chocolate, with notes of vanilla and sweetness. Full body, smooth. Warming notes of quality alcohol. Good beer for long evenings of winter time.

2014-04-19. Black body with a modest tan head. 3++ Aroma is sort of interesting, I cant quite put my finger on what is going on here. There is a not quite dusty quality to the malt, and a vaguely fruity character but fruity is the wrong word. Flavour is similarly interesting with soft subtle not quite dusty sweet malt. Whispers of fruity chocolate, dark malt core. Average bodied palate, soft carbonation. Rich, lovely stuff. On tap at Torst, Brooklyn.

[6266-20140419] Tap. Roasted raisin malt aroma. Black body with a quick foamy light brown head. Roasted coffee raisin flavour. Full body. Good. (7/3/8/3/16) 3.7
(@ Torst, Brooklyn, NY)

Bottle from Drikkeriget, Viktoriagade. Aroma is strong and sweet. Has a smell of alcohol and a deep tone of chocolate. Pours black with a medium brown head. Taste is very smooth. Nice full body with lots of chocolate, malts and some vanilla. Palate has a creamy feeling and fills the mouth nicely. Overall a really nice beer which I dearly recommend.

Bottle. APPEARANCE  Pours delightfully black with light tan head.
NOSE - very light hint of caramel overtones with some malty sweetness.
FLAVOR - out of this world mouth feel and deep rich roasty / bittersweet flavors. truly outstanding porter.
NOTES - Drinks WAY smoother than 11.5%

Black pour with brown 1 finger head.
Smokey, chocolately nose. Rich and creamy body. Toasty chocolatey. Heavy in the smoke.
Semi dry semisweet finish.

Bottle at home. Pours oily black with tan head. Aroma is roast coffee bean, vanilla, liquorice, alcohol, raisin. Flavour is lactose, bittering chocolate, earth, vanilla, coffee. Wonderful creamy smooth mouthfeel. Slight carbonation. Alcohol burn on way down which lets it down.

12 oz bottle about a year old. Pours black with a small dark brown head that retains well and leaves some lacing.

The aroma is sweet roasted chocolate malts with some dark fruit.

The flavor is sweet roasted chocolate malts and dark fruit with a medium bitter roast finish that is slightly ashy. The mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with smooth low carbonation.

Overall, a nice dessert beer. I like the balance of sweet and roast and the alcohol is well hidden with some late warming. This is better than remembered after some aging.

Lil B pours black as the hinges of hell but topped with a heavenly, dense chocolate head and Im already thinking about a scoop of vanilla ice cream. The aroma is boozy, dark vanilla and very dark roasted coffee.
Theres a dryness to the first swallow that seems to only be there to make ready your taste buds for the ensuing flavor that sweeps in like a tidal wave and coats the entire inside of your mouth with a sweet sticky brew.
Leather and tobacco are prominent in the flavor, with black plums chiming in on the back end. As the beer warms and the head fades, I run the liquid around the sides of the snifter and create another island of foam; chocolaty and warm with swirls reminiscent of the skills of an excellent barista.
The high abv is obvious, but the excellent match of flavor to aroma to palate is keeping this particular beverage extremely drinkable. An ashy finish, long and creamy is going to be with me for more than a short while after the brew, but the after taste is very nice.
Im not thinking about vanilla ice cream anymore. Now its Black Cherry in a bowl with Lil B poured all over it...yes...
Very dark color with dark brown foam. Chocolate and roast aromas with hints of cassis.
Black color with small head. Aroma is very fruity with blackcurrant and dangerously sweet. Coffee, roasted malts. Boozy towards the end. Lecker!

12 oz bottle, Andersons. Motor oil black; nearly none of the dark brown head and certainly no lacing. Sweet, light roast, chocolate, licorice, and subtle raspberry. Nice. And 11.5% abv? Never would have guessed.

12 ounce bottle into snifter, bottled on 5/21/2014. Pours dense pitch black color with a small dense dark brown head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of dark/roast/bready malt and moderate dark fruit notes; with good strength. Taste of big dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, fudge, toast, molasses, raisin, prune, licorice, dark bread, light smoke/char, and roasted earthiness. Damn nice complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malts and moderate dark fruit flavors; with a great roasted bitterness/sweetness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light-medium carbonation and full bodied; with a very smooth, creamy, moderately slick, and lightly chalky mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is well hidden with only a light warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent imperial porter. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malts and moderate dark fruit flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the big ABV. A very enjoyable offering.

 Poured from bottle into a snifter

 Appearance  Pours a super thick looking massively dark brown brew that boarders on black. Upon pouring there is only the trace of brown colored foam sitting atop the brew. The foam fades almost instantly leaving little to no lace on the glass. Upon swirling the thickness of the brew can be seen with sticky fingers clinging to the sides of the glass.

 Smell  The aroma is sweet, roasted, and malty. There is a strong brown bread smell mixed with lots of caramel and molasses. Mixed with these aromas is a big chocolate smell that has notes of vanilla and a little bit of dark fruit, overall adding to the sweeter and roasted aromas of the brew. A warming alcohol smell accompanies the darker, roasted, and sweeter smells of the brew creating a sweet roasted cocoa aroma overall.

 Taste  The taste begins with a roasted malt flavor mixed with some flavors of caramel and molasses. A moderately strong and somewhat sweeter chocolate flavor is present upfront as well. A little bit of vanilla soon comes to the tongue adding to the chocolate sweetness. Toward the middle of the taste some of the caramel fades with the chocolate taking on a more dry cocoa like flavor. A big dose of coffee also comes to the tongue more toward the end of the taste intensifying the roasted and darker flavors of the brew. With some oaky booziness also coming to the tongue mixing with the other flavors at the end of the taste a warming dark roasted flavor is left to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the thicker and more viscous side with only a small amount of carbonation. The thickness and lower carbonation are fantastic for the roasted, coffee, cocoa and boozy flavors of the brew and make for a nice slow sipper.

 Overall A rather nice brew overall. It has a sweeter roasted aroma with the taste matching up in the front, but more toward the end it dries out rather nicely creating a nicely roasted flavor to linger on the tongue. A rather nice slow sipper.

Big and bright throughout; oily palate can get a little washy and a lack of tannic balance for these flavors is unfortunate. Flavors are as the nose would intend big chocolate moose light roast and big body however very little alcohol detected. Long baking chocolate finish. Huge body very viscous. Solid!

Bloody good beer. Not everyones cup of tea (well beer, rather) and just one does the trick as its at a whopping 11.5%!!! A nice complex winter beer with massive flavour, like nothing you would get in a standard porter. Well done you crazy Danish/American bastards!!!
Black pour, brown head. Aroma is of chocolate and dark fruit, great flavor of dark chocolate, raisins, and a bit of alcohol.

Draft as well as 12 oz bottle currently. Rating is a coronation of the both samples. Pitch black with tan head that doesnt diminish. Aroma is lovely. Lots of roast, deep barley, chocolate and light vanilla. 
Flavor of molasses, dark chocolate, coffee, brownie batter and burnt grain. The alcohol is noticeable in the bottle but was not at all during the draft sample. Most anything is better on draft. Lots of lingering roast with a dry texture. Secondary flavors of coca nibs and light bitter coffee to help cut the sweetness. Body is full and luscious. A sipper for sure but great flavor overall, I love this brew!

330ml bottle from Brewdog Aberdeen. Pours deep dark brown, thick tan head. Aromas of coffee, dark chocolate. Taste has a note of tar, more chocolate, lots more coffee. Oily texture, long bitter finish. Very nice.
Bottle at Sandar. black colour with a tan head. Aroma is alcohol, chocolate, licorice. Pleasent flavours of : licorice, chocolate, sugar, fruit, coffee. Full body. Very nice beer.

Pours a dark black beer with a beige creamy head.
Smells heavily roasted and coffee like, very little chocolate. 
Tastes malty, roasted and chocolaty.
Has a very big bitter and malty palate. 
Very unique and lovely beer but not for everyone. Needs to be enjoyed slowly.
my goodness gracious this is good. pitch back pour deep brown head. heavy coffee aroma, thick body and nice long lasting coffee bitter chocolate taste
On tap at Biercab. Black colour with beige head. Roasted, chocolate, tobacco aroma. Sweet, caramel, sugar, roasted, chocolate taste. Medium to full body.
Coffee, chocolat, hints of roasted stuff... fkn sweet! Great rounded sweetness... long sweet n dark finish

Really nice smooth silky full bodied porter with a little honey but mostly roasted notes and chocolate. Good bitterness, nice and almost sticky. Alcohol well hidden, something in the aroma I couldnt name, but definately good stuff
Pours a jet black color with tan head. Coffee, some cocoa, and a bit of smoke on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with a smoked coffee note, interesting.

Pours a five-finger, thick brown head that fades slowly leaving a good lace. Black color, no highlights. Medium carbonation and medium-heavy bodied. Nose is chocolate and molasses and flavor is smooth chocolate and molasses malt. Higher ABV is hidden. Decent Imp porter. $4.99 for a 12oz bottle from Julios Liquors Westborough, MA. Bottled Feb 19, 2014.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours pitch black with a thick and dense tan head. Nose is quite one dimensional and a little boring - kind of like a tim tam in that its loads of chocolate biscuit and not a great deal of anything else. taste is a different animal though. Loads of burnt fig, wet wood, mild smoke and vanilla with a heavy but very smooth milk chocolate finish. Smooth as they come and the booze is hidden expertly. Great stuff

Bottle from Bottledog, Kings Cross. Not far off black. Thin, sticky, lasting, tan head. Chocolate malt. 60% cocoa solids chocolate. Marshmallow. Vine fruits. Booze. Taste and palate are luscious, thick, malty, fruity sweetness. Doesnt feel 11%, by a long way. Finish is boozy, dry, cocoa bitter. Preposterously silly, easy to drink. Lovely.
Pitch black in the glass with a small head. Siropy and malty, mostly sweet coffee. Better as expected.
36cl, new exclusive Danish brew Anno 2012, from Geers Oostakker, complex Porter, sweet/roasted and slightly spicy/fruity, yet not too heavy, balanced, hazy, good head, good brew, yet expensive!

Bottle at home. Medium high creamy lasting brown head. pitch black body. Roasted malt cocoa coffed druied fruit aroma. Heavily carbonated smooth cocoa coffee cream flavor with a hint of bitterness. Long sweet finish. Alcohol well hidden.

Draught at Brewers Beer Bar, Göteborg. Pitch black beer with a small beige head. Fruity roasted aroma, vinous, caramel, licorice, figs, raisins, caramel, licoriice. Roasted chocolate flavor, licorice, cocoa, vinous, caramel, biscuits, figs, raisins, alcohol is quite well hidden.

Bottle from Ølbutikken, Copenhagen. Black color, brown head. Bitter taste with hops, coffee, roasted malts, nuts, alcohol, licorice and a bit of vanilla. Bitter finish with hops, nuts, licorice and coffee. Exquisite imperial porter.
bottle, pours motor oil black with almost no head and no lacing. Great dark musky coffee, burnt sugars nose. Deep dark chewy mouth feel. A bit sweet, but balanced. Massive long finish. Great beer.

Pours black with a dark tan head.
Nose shows roasted malt, coffee liqueur, soft booze, sweet caramel, dried fruit. Lovely.
Similarly roasty and bold flavours. Liquorice, coffee liqueur, hot alcohol, spicy and piny hops. Aggressive finish with a big roasty and hoppy bitterness.
Creamy mouthfeel, very smooth.
Black pour with brown head. Aromas of molasses, toasted berries, rum. Full bodied, smooth. Roasted with dark berries, burnt and boozy finish. Really good.

12 oz. bottle packaged on 6/10/13 poured into shaker. Deep opaque ebony color with no real head whatsoever. Rich, roasty aroma of coffee, chocolate, tobacco and alcohol. Flavor is sweet and malty without being cloying accompanied by just the right amount of smoke. Mouthfeel is smooth and vinous. Theres definitely an alcohol presence, but not one that belies its actual ABV. If they were to call this an imperial stout, I wouldnt question it. This is the first Evil Twin offering Ive tried, and overall Im very impressed.
Bottle. Smoky chocolate and coffee aroma. Some alchohol on the palate but not that much considering the abv. Overall: 16/20

33cl bottle from Kris Wines, London. Trappist glass. Pours a dark brown with tan coloured head, settling quickly. Aromas of yeast, alcohol, caramel, and brown sugar. Taste is sweet and malty, with perfume notes, finishing with espresso that lingers. Very good brew, highly recommended.

355 ml bottle from Baggot St Wines. Black pour, mocha creme head. Coffee, roast malt on the nose. Intensely rich luscious, coffee in the flavour, nice and bitter yet not over the top. Lovely mouthfeel, perfectly judged carbonation. Bitter coffee finish. Lovely.

Chocolatey brown black with a bright brown head. aroma is sweet, with chocolate and raisins. Taste is the same, but very powerful, though not overwhelmingly alcoholic, and it has a strong cocoa note, with a finish of slight licorice. $4/12oz

Sample thx to Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: black beer, little to no beige head.
NOSE: mocha, chocolate, coffee.
TASTE: mocha, alcohol, coffee.

Black as night this beauty!
A small but creamy head with a little lacing..tastes heavy in coffee and caramel...you get a roast coffee after taste, with an almost heat sensation.
The mouth feel is thick and oily.
Overall a Great beer that hides the 11.5% well.
Pours a deep black. A lot going on with the aromas from chocolate, roasted malts, caramel and a big whack of alcohol. Fantastic complex taste to go with the aroma.

Keg @ CBC covent garden - pours a great oily black body with a small but dense brown head. Intense caramel and chocolate aroma, berries, some sugar. Still hides somewhat yhe true quality of the beer. Taste is deep, rich and lenghty. Incredible depth in the aftertaste. Lots of molasses, dark fruit, toffee. Silky mouthfeel with a good balancing bitterness.

33cl bottle. Pours pitch black with a nice but fast diminishing head. Aroma is heavy sweet, roasted malt, chocolate, moderate alchool. Flavor is heavy sweet and light bitter, sticky with notes of roasted malt, chocolate, alchool leading to a dry end. Roasted aftertaste.

Bottle from Ølbutikken, Copenhagen. Pours an oily black body with a small creamy beige head. Aroma is coffee, dark berries, syrup, chocolate and hints of dark malts, bread crusts and caramel. Taste is sweet syrupy malt tones, dark berries, chocolate, licorice, grains and hints of caramel, bread, bitter herbs and vanilla. Full body, medium carbonation. Solid enough, though not thoroughly impressive.

12 oz bottle. Pours black with a light tan head that dissipates quickly. Aromas of licorice, chicory, and heavily roasted sweet malts. Rich flavors of dark chocolate, nuts, black licorice/anise, and roasted malts. A little alcohol is noticeable - heat and taste. Otherwise great.

Bottle from notes. Pours dark brown to black in color with a small tan head. The aroma and flavor have roasted malts, dark chocolate, dark fruits, plums, a hint of smoke, earthy bitterness to the finish. Flavors are big and bold; enjoyable.

Shared by RussianDragon. Thanks Dave. Sitting on the porch in the springtime sippin on Lil B.

the beer is near black with over an inch of foamy beige head. The aroma brings coca, bitter chocolates, coffee, dark roast. Taste is solid. Im a fan. Big robust beer and well balanced. Full bodied and palate coating, yet easy drinking. We had no problem finishing the bottle. Very tasty.

Bottle. Pours a pitch black beer with a nice, medium sized beige head. Aroma has loads of booze, licorice, dark sugars and caramel. Even some alcoholic bourbon notes detected. Flavor is very sweet and cloying. Alcohol is definitely noticeable, not burning. Loads of sweet, sugary flavors of molasses and caramel. Well balanced, great stuff.

Bottle shared with MrHangover. Opaque pitch black color, average sized brown head. Aroma and taste are malts, roasty, slightly alcohol and a hint of liquor, nicely bitter especially in the finish. Oily texture, medium to full body and carbonation. Nice!

Small bottle. Pours very dark brown, big beige head. Nose is fudge, anise, dark fruit. Flavour has some roast in the background, lots of choc and anise, very silken, smack-you-in-the-face type beer, and really well done.

Bottle from Total Wine in Jensen Beach with a 3/17/13 bottle date. Pours blacker-than-cola colored with a brown head. No real lacing. Aroma has heavy roast, bitter chocolate, cocoa nibs and some molasses. Taste is of bakers chocolate, sweet caramel, heavy roast, espresso and some lactose. Somewhat mochaccino and cookies. Medium to full bodied. Very little alcohol presence. Finishes somewhat long and bittersweet, and a bit rough. Lot of good/interesting parts - the total does not quite equal the pieces or it would be world class.
Beautiful. Dark black body with reddish brown head, last a while considering its a porter. Lactose and coffee aroma. Taste is roast malts, burnt toast, Some sweet malts and booze. Awesome porter.

Very dark brown, medium beige head. Aroma sweet malts, nutty, vanilla, mocha. Full body. Creamy mouthfeel. Warming alcohol presence. Complex flavors. Pretty sweet. Malty, molasses, vanilla and chocolate. Obviously for sipping. Really good.

tap @ Blue Monk. Black, rich mokah head. Nose is burnt malt, some cardboard, cocoa, super rich fig, umami/soy, chocolate covered cherries. Flavor is burnt malt, big caramel, some oxidation, cherries, raisin, umami/soy. Big burnt bittersweet cherries, raisin & chocolate in the finish. Nice enough but the oxidation/cardboard really detracts.

Bottle. Man, this is basically a thinner Expedition Stout. Loads of that dark fruit, tobacco, and earthy coffee that make expedition so great. Does not linger as much and is not nearly as creamy, but its damn good.

12oz bottle in a teku. Pours black with a dark tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, dark chocolate and coffee, hints of dark fruits, and some dough. Flavor the same with a nice blend of everything. Smooth texture. A solid beer.
Botella de 33 cl. Cerveza negra intensa, aroma a tostado y licor, sabor ligeramente dulce a café, chocolate, notable presencia del alcohol. Interesante.

Pours a deep burnt umber color with a finger of khaki foam. Lots of rich dark bakers chocolate, dark fruits, some earthy ash, tar, some lingering roastiness and bitter coffee. Solid offering, touch of boozy heat but not overly hot considering abv !

Bottle, shared during our epic night at MicroBar in Reykjavik, with Arnie and Stein. Hearty near-black pour. Sweet coffee and cocoa aroma. Silky smooth palate, filled with flavourful dark malts, fresh ground espresso beans, figs, and cocoa. Not even a hint of the 11.5% ABV, so smooth and rich.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Small bottle. Pours a very dark brown with minimal light brown skiff. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, raisin, prune. Taste is subtly sweet with a strong bitterness. Chewy. Low carbonation. Wickedly dry finish.

Bottle. Opaque black liquid with small to medium tan head. Aroma of licorice, coffee, chocolate, dried fruit and raw sugar. Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of licorice, dried fruit, raw sugar and coffee. Full bodied with low to medium carbonation. Quite nice.

Very interesting beer overall. The label is one of the worst Ive ever seen. The pour is a pure black with a gloopy, viscous consistency and a dark tan head that fades. The nose is surprisingly fruity and sweet smelling with a balancing roast character of espresso and milk chocolate. The first sip has a lactose like sweetness and accompanying fruit flavours. The finish is appropriately bitter and robust with a big roast, warm alcohol on the finish and a dusting of espresso and cocoa. A unique brew...

Nice beer, great aroma fresh off the pour, mellows with standing. 
Vanilla, caramel on the nose, smooth, nice thick mouth feel.

Black viscous pour with small dark khaki head. Aroma of massive chocolate, roasted malts, caramel and fruit. Taste of creamy chocolate, roasted malts, vanilla, fudge and a faint fruit presence. Full bodied, creamy mouthfeel, slightly lower carbonation, delicious beer!

Excellent imperial porter, thicker than an average one, tastier too and perfectly brewed. Delicious aromas to liquor and biscuit, avoiding the classical protagonist role of coffee-ish notes. The mouthfeel is overwhelming, enriched by the velvety-creamy texture. Great, very great, stuff.
Lil B- rich and sweet with flavors of red wine, prune, cocoa, lemon, and black pepper. Starts thick and sweet, followed by tartness, and a heavy alcohol burn. 3.4/5

Bottle bought at Champanes, 
this porter had a dark brown (almost black) pour that looked viscous, and presented a one finger tan colored head that receded to a scattered cover that had mostly open areas and a ring, there was no sediment in the bottle, 

there were aromas of intense toasted malt with some roasted malt, a little nut, some smoke, and a touch of dark bread, 
faint earthy malt notes in the background, there were a few dark fruit notes that resembled prunes and raisins that were over cooked but not burnt, some dark brown sugar and molasses sweetness, 

the flavors were intense toasted malt with a bit of roasted malt, dark bread notes with faint dark fruit, dark roasted nut, 
coffee, brown sugar and molasses sweetness, the finish had malt and coffee bitterness that clung the palate and hung around a bit, 

the mouth feel was pretty full and thick, this drink coated the tongue and lips, it had a little bit of a creamy feel, the carbonation was soft to average, 

this was a intense porter beer, resembles an imperial stout but with a big toasted malt base instead of roasted malt, there was just a little roasted malt, it was thick and covered the tongue, a drink I would enjoy on a cold evening next to a fireplace, a nice drink.

12oz brown bottle. Thick and slick looking black pour. Small brown head taht fades into a tiny ring. Rich nose, chocolate malts and roast. Taste has roast, chocolate/choco syrup and some light smoky/peat notes. Medium to full bodied body with a slick mouthfeel, carbonation is on the soft side. Late alcohol warming, roasty finish, some smoke/peat there too. Overall a heavy brew, nice.

Bottle, Beer Moth, Manchester. Deep dark brown pour crowned with a shy tan head. Coffee and choc predominant in the beak. Sweetish taste with some roast, coffee, choc and berry fruit notes. Smooth and full bodied with a little alco heat, and some bitterness emerging towards the finale. A very handy sipper. E-Z B.

12 oz bottle. Pours a thick black with a brown head. Very strong raisin aroma, molasses and bubble gum, boozy. Molasses and raisin flavor, syrupy sweet. Its pretty tasty, though pretty thick. In the end I think I like it!

From notes. 22 oz bottle on March 15. The pour is gorgeous! Dark black pour with an incredibly dark khaki head and no lace. The aroma is good. Theres a great chocolatey roast, and some alcohol on the front end that carries all the way through, like a good porter should. The flavor is much of the same; strong chocolate and roast, with a little smokiness on the back end. The mouth feel is really, really thick, with a great creaminess and delightful carbonation. The aftertaste is dry and roasty. This is a greatly executed porter!

Nearly black, very very dark brown in color with orange hues and a short-lived head, this beer smells like its worth a million bucks. I should have bought two bottles of these! It smells dark, sweet, high in alcohol, and a little greasy. Its light in the mouth and easier than I expected, with smoke and hints of wood well-pronounced. Its flavor profile is dense, offering a sharp, very highly roasted malt character and a punch-in-your-face roasted bitterness accompanied by a smooth, silky mouthfeel. The more you drink of this the more that smoke starts to taste like peat. Its soft, but robust, and high in alcohol. Yet it pulls it off soft, easy, and smoothly.

Poured from bottle into a tulip: Whoo this one is strong! Pours blacker and thicker than a melted tire. Aroma is burned everything, malt, raisins, currants, dark fruit, and plastic. Taste is boozy but balanced with hints of coffee, chocolate, raisin and malt. Full body, very heavy, slightly cloying. Good but man thats strong.

15th March 2014Opaque black - brown beer, good tan head. Palate is airy and slightly soft, good minerally carbonation. Smooth rich dark malt, subtle coffee and dark chocolate. Mild dark malt cream. Whisper of dark fruits. Smooth semi dry finish. Dark chocolate linger. Pretty straight down the line Imperial Porter, decent.

Bottle. Black with a tan head that fades to a fat coat then lasts. Big noseful of molasses/ fudge/ dark rum, raisins, under-ripe plums, aniseed, coffee, a little smoke, licorice. Getting towards syrupy. Very sweet and rich with some dark fruit, but all lifted away by insistent bitterness and spices as it dries out at the end. A bit rummy but not hot at the end, too. Maybe a little over the top, but pretty good.

Bowling ball black, consistency of motor oil. Ring of tan head around the rim. Absolutely opaque. Agitation puts a brown swirl in the middle like a cafe mocha. 

Aroma is sour dates, raisins. Dusty mocha. Dry cereal grain malts. There is the slightest hint of plastic (Band-Aid). 

The flavor is supremely burnt, bitter chocolate and black coffee. Those stone fruits in the aroma are absent in the flavor.

The feel is oily but also dry at the end. Leaves a bitter, dry remnant in the aftertaste and feel.

I gotta say, this beer is a little bit "extreme." All the flavors are great, but there is no sweet respite. Its a big, bitter, beat of a beer. D*mn.
bottle at the local taphouse in sydney. pretty close to black with a thin brown head; aroma of cocoa cream; rumnraisin flavours, finishes quite sweet. rich and thick - an excellent dessert beer

12 oz bottle from Kensington Wine Market in Calgary, served in a stem glass. Pours deep black with a small tan head that remains and leaves a small amount of fine lace. The nose has big notes of roasted malt, molasses and caramel, along with smoke, a touch of anise and vanilla. The flavour is moderately sweet with roasted malt, tobacco and a touch of cocoa. The finish is long, roasty, slightly smokey, and a bit alcoholic. On the palate it is medium-full in body with a smooth, creamy texture and soft carbonation. Overall, a truly great, elegant, complex imperial porter. It has the complexity of a barrel-aged imperial stout but a slightly lighter body and smokier malts. An amazing beer. 2014-03-12

Medium head dark pour soft mild carbonation the aromas dark chocolate molasses raisin mocha coffee caramel fudge vanilla milo cocoa the flavours malt rich chocolate mocha coffee cocoa fudge vanilla raisin rich dried fruit roasted touch medium to strong bitter such a lovely taste on the tongue velvety crisp molasses touch sweet caramel rewarding tastes the finish the flavour input is remarkable malt and more malt fruits a plenty sweetness and bitter balance some roast notes a wonderful imperial porter
Great one. Light sweet smell and taste before the toasted malt appears. Well balanced. The alcohol comes with the biterness at the end.
This is a great tasting porter. Sweet and smokey. Great looking dark pour and nice little lacing brown head. Great porter.

12 oz bottle courtesy of clt85. Thanks. Pours a viscous black with a small tan head that soon fades to a fine ring. The aroma is strong with dark fruits, molasses and anise. The taste mirrors the aroma with black strap, dates, cocoa and anise. The palate is full and a bit oily with soft carbonation. The finish is long and dry with lingering molasses. Overall: First rate impy porter.
On tap at Torst. Solid porter with extra mouthfeel and bold taste, like a 1.5 X porter. Decent drinkability, abv not so noticeable.
This is a fantastic Porter!!! I really enjoyed the rich smooth flavor. It is hard to believe it is 11.5%

Bottle, beautiful rich black with dark milk chocolate resinous head that slowly fades. Aroma, sweet brown sugar, dark fruit, coffee, smells a lot like the dark horizon beer I just had a week ago, but not as bold and aromatic, pretty nice though. Taste, smooth, velvety mouthfeel, very sweet up front, dark fruits, a bit of hops towards the middle, a dry lingering finish reminiscent a nice dry stout. Nice beer, really ET doesnt do anything that I dont like and occasion blows my mind, Cheers!

Very dark brown with a large tan head that never quite goes away. Lots of lacing, appears to be very well crafted. The aroma reveals graham crackers, leather, earthiness, and alcohol. Very strange description, but this is a very complex-scented brew. I could get a different scent note from every whiff. Taste was a little weak. Surprisingly watery up front, roasty and tons of booze in an aftertaste that goes away very quickly. Thin on the palate, easy drinking for how strong it is, but I would like more complexity. Evil Twin can do better; this was not one of my favorite ET selections.

Pours a very dark brown brown with a fluffy beige head that quickly fades to a thin ring around the glass. Aroma is chocolate, toffee, and espresso. Flavor is the same as the aroma with a mineral character. A very full rich mouthfeel and finishes with a bitter, dry, espresso like finish.

Bottle 330ml @ Sandar Haandverksbryggeri - Brygghuset
Pours pitch black with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, caramel, alcohol and licorice. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and light to medium bitter with a long roasted and chocolate finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Draft at the growler NYC. Deep black color with no lace. Smells and taste sweet with chocolate taste. Heavy sweet peer with a nice aftertaste. Decent

Une petite bouteille qui crache un liquide profondément brun. Un anneau de mousse beige foncé sinstalle sans cérémonie. Je remarque quelques traces collées sur la paroi de mon verre. Le nez est un mélange appétissant de mélasse, de réglisse et de vanille chocolatée. La bouche est bien bonne, pleine de caramel brûlé, de vanille et de café aromatisé. Lalcool est habilement caché. Aujourdhui, il fait 26 degrés à Hollywood et je pense que ce gros porter est parfaitement conçu pour les journées fabuleuses. Boire sous les palmiers, chienne de vie.

Bottle, at Sandar. It pours a dark brown body under a small, dense light tan head. The aroma has salty licorice, roasted malts and a touch of coffee. Dark chocolate too. The flavor is sweet, with licorice, roasted malts, coffee hints, dark chocolate and a warning alcohol touch. Full body and a soft carbonation, lightly oily. Lasting roasted finish. Pretty lovely this one, but a bit boozy. 140216
Strong, very smooth body, hides ABV well. Burnt wood and blackcurrant, dark chocolate. Not overly sweet but missing a strong roast component to balance out the malts. Still very enjoyable.

$3.80 Bottle, Wine Warehouse, CHO.

Pours black & slightly thick, inch of dark brown head. Smells of chocolates. Tastes of chocolates, coffee, metal, and coffee beans. Nice and thick. Would be great without the metallic taste.

average frothy light brown head. fair lacing. fully diminishing. flat thick black body. aroma: heavy malty, dark chocolate, mild coffee, raisin. if: moderate sweet light bitter. ff: moderate sweet bitter; long duration. palate: medium full body, oily texture, lively carbonation, metallic heavy alcoholic finish.R$21,30; sabor frutas secas, Porter mais complexa que já provei, geralmente são aguadas, tradicional e forte presença de café no paladar, dulçor de chocolate. Bottle. Soft chocolate malts, minerals, some coffee, cola, 
Dirty black with lace. Cloudy. Sweet with some roast and acidity. Coffee, chocolate, dark berries, quite acidic. Very spritzy, high but small carbonation. Nice.
Overall: Heavy buttered chocolate cake.Note: Bottle 330 ml at the Horse and Hound. Reviewed 2014-02-08.

From a 355ml bottle on 8/2/2014. Pours close to black with virtually the smallest of heads. Has a powerful aroma, quite sharp aroma featuring dried dark fruit, roasted malt and booze. Taste wise, there is a lot going on, with roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, raisins, and booze all featuring prominently. Its relatively sweet but this is appropriately met by quite a firm roasty bitterness. The palate is syrupy with the carbonation a touch below average. Its quite a challenging brew and shows its 11.5%, but theres still oodles of great stuff to be enjoyed here, particularly as it warms.

Out of 12oz bottle. I am really impressed with this beer. Very boozy, but it smells great and has a lingering taste that is very complex. I would go out of my way to have this again.

Huge body, small head, nearly black colour, nose of roasted sugars, grains and nuts, pours like molasses, tastes bitter, slightly of iron. (No where near Guinness Double Stout but it is there.) Remarkable but not something Id have more than once.

2/3/2014. Pours black with a beige head. Aromas of dark roasted malt, chocolate, dark fruit, spices, licorice. Chocolate and licorice flavors, but with a little too much booze for my taste. Overall not bad at all.

Pours moter oil black with a very creamy head that must be drank to dissipate. Big aromas of brownie, chocolate, light roast, wood, oak. Flavors of chocolate malt, like smoke, light French oak, light sherry, light subtle vanilla notes (coming through from wood perhaps), brownie. Silky texture with a medium roasted aftertaste. Medium sweet. Rated right after a buffalo bandits game.

Bottle (330 ml). Very dark brown (almost black) with a small quickly diminishing reddish brown head and no lacing. Aroma of liquorice, dark fruits, chocolate, roasted malt, vanilla, spices and caramel. Taste is moderately sweet with liquorice, fruits, chocolate, roasted malt, vanila, caramel, spices and a warming (alcohol) finish). Full bodied. Moderate carbonation. Spicy finish. A tad too much going on in this one, so the balance is so-so. Complex. Not so drinkable, even for the style.

Color negro con reflejos caobas y espuma beige oscuro densa, pero poco persistente. Aromas de frutos rojos, madera, tostados y licor. En boca es densa y entra con un ligero dulzor que pasa a una ligera acidez tostada y de madera con toques afrutados. El final y el regusto es licoroso y seco.

This has lots of fresh brownie and espresso in the aroma - mmm. However, I wasnt blown away by the taste - day-old coffee and cocoa powder dominate. It is more interesting on the palate, where it brings some warmth and astringency. A good big beer, but a little overrated imo.

Bottle @ Brouwers Café: &nbsp Black, thin to moderate frothy beige head, some legs in the lacing. &nbsp Rich roasted malt nose, some dark chocolate, a little charred wood, but also a slight touch of cow pasture. &nbsp Rich sweet and roasty malts on the tongue, dark chocolate, charred wood, and thankfully not that cow pasture I got on the nose. &nbsp Warming but not alcoholic. &nbsp Moderate to full body and mouthfeel. &nbsp Very rich on the finish. &nbsp A little ashy on the backside. &nbsp Great beer!
Black colour. Coffee chocolate aromas. Rich chocolate flavour. Very tasty beer.

courtesy of Thomas - black beer with a fast collapsing foam; huge roasted chocolatey aroma, notes of pralines and coffee too; hints of vanilla; full-bodied and with some initial sweetness; very bitter; long roasted coffeish and chocolatey finish with some warming alcohol notes

Draft in a sampler at Ei8ht Ball. Pours a deep, virtually opaque brown with a small lighter brown head. The aroma is a bit smoky, with roasted malts, toasted sugar, dark chocolate, salted caramel, and a hint of dark fruit and anise. The flavor starts out the same, but instantly drops into more soy and rubbery notes, with just a little bit of chocolate and brown sugar to balance. Medium-bodied, with very little carbonation and a flat, bitter mouthfeel. Very strange. Im glad I only had a little bit of this.

Cellar temperature and into a chalice. Low pffft and a swift release of gas before nothing. Into the glass it goes and it pours like used engine oil. An head of homebrew consistency forms and falls. Loose, mucky deep brown suds last little more than the time it takes for a whiff and a smile. Aroma is dominated by bready, fresh baked biscuit soaked in rich, milk chocolate. The beer pours like dark roast coffee, oozing between a deep brown and a black coloring. It pours with a tiny head of miniscule, dark khaki bubbles (as is expected at this ABV), which quickly slicks into a scrim ring along the glass. The beer leaves a super slick, thin curtain of lacing when it washes over the glass, along with a small set of legs to suggest its alcohol content. In body, the beer is too dark to penetrate, but as it pours it does not seem to be the thickest thing to ever come out of a bottle On the nose, the beer smells richly fruity with dark plum, raisin, and chocolate notes. Brown sugar and dates also appear on the nose, along with the ghost of fusel alcohol. The smell is richly fruity both in malt and yeast character, blending with slight nutty smells. Roast coffee is also present, but it is sitting beside a very pungent raisin/date/plum dipped in brown sugar and chocolate. On the tongue, the beer tastes richly sweet at first, almost cloying with definite alcohol notes, but this perfectly melds into a dry, lightly bitter roast as the beer finishes. There is a light, tart pop at the back of the finish, which adds a level of complexity that I did not expect from this beer. In flavor, the beer begins as sweet plums dipped in a light chocolate. Faint raisins and brown sugar dance on the tongue after the initial flavor, but they are buoyed along by cloying, sweet alcohol that takes a little away from the beer. Luckily, this alcohol is very brief, and is bludgeoned aside by beautiful, dry, French roast coffee. A touch of vanilla and cinnamon, also, bring light spice to the tongue, perhaps from the alcohol, just as the coffee flavor moves in. The finish is light, but long and gives hints of praline, pecans and milk chocolate. In the mouth, this beer feels silky smooth and on the heavy side of medium in body. Carbonation is smooth and velvety, blanketing the tongue in oozing goodness. The mouth is left roasted dry and slightly sticky. Overall, this is a beautifully complex and rich porter. Its thinner mouthfeel and silkiness definitely lend it to the porter style, and not to the thick and chewy stouts, but it works beautifully. I think it could do with a little aging to smooth out the cloying alcohol in the middle of the sip, but I still think its great to drink now.
