Bottle. Pours bark brown/black, with a very small brown head. Aroma is molasses, roasted malt, dark fruit, and hops. Flavor is molasses, roasted malt, bitter chocolate, dark fruit, Medium body, with a sweet finish. Some alcohol in the finish, too. Low carbonation, but it is there.

Pours dark rich coffee brownish black in color with a creamy small burnt cinnamon caramel head. The aroma brings light nutty roasted and sweet malts. The flavor brings the same, lightly sweetened roasted sweet nutty malts. There is almost a bit of peanut butter flavor in there and the booze is tame enough to bring such a smooth body and no booze at all on the tongue.

Bomber from Dr. Capone.  Pours thick turbid and jet black with minimal brown head.  Nose is tart sour mashy blackberry and cherry, roasty black patent malt, cacao, hops.  Tastes thick, rich, very complex and dense on the palate:

Front:  Roasty malt, sweet syrupy blackstrapmolasses
Mid-Palate:  Some tartness, fig and blackberry
Finish:  Hops come out, more malt and dark fruit/berry/plum sweetness, Well hidden alcohol throughout.  This one is very good, but a bit sweet and under-attenuated and cloying late.  Still, thats like saying you wouldnt bang Reese Witherspoon because her feet look uglier than Frodos.

Draft. Blackish beer with a light tan head. Chooclate and light roast aroma with light nuttiness. Big dark chocolate flavor with light roast and toffee. Medium bodied. Big chocolate lingers with toffee, light licorice, and light roast.

Bottle. Thanks to Søren! Pours black with a brown head. Aroma has mellow chocolate, rosted malts, dark sweet fruits, earthy coffee and vanilla. Very soft edges and overall balanced out nicely. Taste has roasted fruity coffee, sweet liquorce, vanilla, chocolate cake, weak salty, syrup and hints of smoke. This is a smooth operator!

Draft at Monks. Opaque pour with a dark red brown head. Juicy dark flavors. Tobacco. Prunes. Chocolate caramel. Raisins. Mushrooms. Candied cherries. Somewhat syrupy porter. Dark and full. Half bitter, half sweet but some spice to round things out. Big dark caramel porter.

On tap. Deep black color, looks very thick. Little brown head, leaves good lace. Big roasty aroma, nuts, dark fruit, vanilla. Some wood. Little tobacco. Bitter taste, little warmth, but not too boozy. Big body, good chewiness, not sticky in the finish, nice amount of dry texture. Good full mouthfeel. A standout imperial porter.

Bottle. Pours pitch black motor oil. Aroma is loads of vanilla, chocolate, sweet liquorice, matroshatte, burnt sugar, roasted malt, dried fruits, som red berries. Lovely aroma! Really smooth palate, taste follows the nose. No sharpness what so ever straight up softness and smoothness.  Some warmth from the alcohol, a bit tingly, grassy, and some roasted bitterness.

Draft. Poured dark brown color with an small frothy brown head that mostly lasted with fair lacing. Moderate toasted malt dark fruit and chocolate aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy dark fruit toasted sweet flavor with medium to heavy sweet finish of moderate duration. Solid complex beer.

Bottle. Pours black with thin brown head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, and soy sauce. Wait, is this really a Porter? It feels more like a Stout. Oh well.... Flavor is sweet with notes of chocolate and coffee. Pretty heavy for a Porter but if Evil Twin says it?s a Porter than it?s a Porter.

Pours black into a snifter. Mocha head with limited retention recedes to hug rim. Licorice, caramel and soy aromas. Thick with dark chocolate, soy, anise, and resin upfront and through the middle turning to a latte finish.

22 oz bottle. It pours very thick and black with a very small orange/brown head that shrinks to a ring quickly. The aroma is very fudgy with some distinct fruity notes (mostly raisins and prunes). Very mildly roasted. The flavor reflects the aroma with lots of raisins, prunes, chocolate and some char at the very finish. Pretty sweet. Roasted character barely comes through with this one. This kind of reminds me of what Dark Lord tasted like. The palate is very thick and modestly carbonated. Alcohol is well hidden. Pretty tasty sipper, but not what I was expecting.

651ml bottle. Poured a black color with a small sized brown head. Aromas of roast, cocoa, earth, and some dark fruits. Tastes of chocolate, caramel, brown sugar, dark fruits, vanilla, and roast. Creamy body.

Draught. Pours a very dark and thick brown with very little head. A little bit of roasted and sweet smells to it, but a very weak nose to it. The taste was really sweet and fruity, which is not want I want in a porter. I did not care for this one.

Very pricey bottle (that im pretty sure was marked down a few dollars to $13) but I had heard several good reviews from some people I trust so I made the plunge.  Definitely a dessert sipper here, but its not overly cloyingly sweet like I half-expected.  Lots of chocolate, some black cherry (skins and juice), light coffee, and light vanilla.  Very good stuff, quite decadent, but I wouldnt want to drink more than 4 ounces or so at a time.  Definitely not bomber to drink solo.

651mL from Chevy Chase Wine and Liquor. $18 bottle, one of the most expensive beers Ive bought at a store :0   Pours ink with a dense, sheen, mocha head. Excellent formation and retention. Small bubbles, thick. Nose is sharp white birch, balsa wood, cinnamon, nutmeg, hints of green olive and brine overpowered by white pepper, freshly chopped wood, some roasted sweet peppers. Taste is very dense and chewy, some lactic chocolate mousse, thick chocolate silk cake, creme brûlée, even lemon custard. Palate is very dense, ultra silky finishing with some sharp citrus sourness and lemon icebox pie. Woah. This is some good stuff. Very interesting with a medley of dark flavors that I dont think Ive seen together before. Palate gets just a tad papery as it warms. But overall the beer is not heavy or sticky, almost aerated and fluffy given the abv and mega dark chocolate character.

22oz bomber thanks to GT2. Pours opaque inky black. Thick, coffee head. Aroma is dark chocolate smores, cinnamon, rich and thick creme brûlée. Taste is orgasmic dark chocolate mousse, creamy dessert, whipped cream, crust. Mouthfeel is very rich, creamy, not sticky sweet. Nice bitterness to balance. Hints of sweetness with bitter cocoa. I love it!

Draft @ Barcade w e. Black pour, red tint on edges. Sweet choco-malt aroma, very sweet chocolate on the palate w notes of booze, raspberries, and milk cholcolate. Thin mouthfeel. Overall takeaway is sweet dark chocolatey fruit.
Bottle sample at Big Beers.  Really nice and this is one of my fave styles. Dominated by molasses.

A rich super charged imperial porter with candy sweet chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, and dark fruits throughout. Pours a pretty opaque dark brown with a thin collar of brown head. Alcohol legs are in abundance. a great mix of deep earthy chocolate malt and juicy raisins, but lacking the hop bitterness to balance it out. Winds up being a bit cloying, but still leaves a brownie and wine fade that is quite pleasant.
Sampled at an esbls tadting.  Black and thick looking.  Only a ring of foam.  Sweet rich malts in the nose.  Rich malts and complex dark fruit are tasted.  Some soy, too.  This is big, bad, and good.

Shared bomber to oversized snifter.  Looks good; pitch black with thin mocha lacing.  Smells good too; chocolate and malt.  Tastes like it smells with a good mouthfeel.  Reminds me of a slightly thinner, slicker version of Soft Dookie.

The best porter Ive ever tasted, hands down. Im not usually a big fan of Baltic style porters, only because I find them to be too sweet, but this Imperial version is deceptively complex. At first, I thought it was a bit flabby in texture, and totally straightforward in flavor. However, as I continued to sip this voluptuous monster, flavors other than chocolate, toffee, and vanilla began to emerge...leather, tobacco, plum, kumquat, raisin, sandalwood, smoke, Cabernet, and bourbon began to poke out their heads, seemingly out of nowhere. The richness continued to build, but the sweetness never became overbearing, and leveled out at just the right point.

This may be the best Evil Twin Ive tasted, which is even more surprising when one takes note of the fact that its a contract brew executed by Westbrook Brewing Co of Mount Pleasant, S.C. Id never heard of them, but Ill definitely be looking for any future nationally distributed beers of theirs.

Appearance: jet black - motor oil. Fluffy tan head that collapses to a thin ring.

Smell: chocolate, caramel, fruity, a little coffee. Much heavier on the chocolate/fruit than coffee.

Taste: revelatory. Chocolate, fruit, caramel, gentle coffee. This is a porter rather than a stout - the chocolate is up front and centre, the coffee is in the background, but still there.

Mouthfeel: for such a thick beer the mouthfeel is lovely - dense and creamy rather than viscous.

Aftertaste: rich caramel fruit, chocolate, light coffee.

As it warms: the coffee becomes more apparent in the nose, but the flavour leans to more chocolate and fruits.

This is a truly wonderful beer deserving of more recognition.

Draught @ Beer Revolution, Oakland

Pours pitch black with a tiny head. Aroma of roasted malts, licorice, molasses, hints of syrup and chocolate. Taste is roasty and sweetish with some molasses, chocolate, syrupy notes. Finish is smooth and full bodied with some sweetish and roasty notes. Nice, quite well balanced imperial porter, but a tad too sweet for my taste.

On tap at Beer Revolution. Black with almost no head. Sweet cherry vinegar chocolate and amber incense aroma and taste with light coffee notes and a strong smokey incense finish. Thick oily palate.  One of the more interesting beers Ive tried lately.

draft at Blue Monk, poured in a snifter. big thick black pour. darker tan head. beautiful looking beer. intense roasted malt aroma, chocolate, wierd olive juice smell that subsided as i drank it. Big agressive flavor, 11.5 no doubt, huge roast, chocolate abound. Full mouthfeel. Good stuff

Served on draft at Maxs. Pours a very dark brown color with a large brown head. Good head retention. Aroma of rich roasted malts, coffee, sweet malts, cocoa and vanilla. The taste is rich roasted malts, chocolate, cherries, vanilla and herbal notes. Medium bodied. 5600th rating!

Draft at sb. Pours jet black with a scant tan head even after a fully vigorous pour. Huge beautiful intensely bourbony and chocolatey nose. Sticky thick body with low carb. Intensely sweet chocolate and bourbon and prune and date mid palate with a long sticky sweet finish.
Bottle. Darkest brown pour with a medium beige head. Aroma of chocolate, malt and caramel. Chocolate and grainy malt flavor with a chocolate finish.
